Description: Seppeltsfield's Centennial wines have been released annually for past 140 years and are believed to be the only single-vintage wines with such unbroken lineage on the planet. While the full composition is unknown, this now 101-year-old wine is composed primarily of Shiraz and Grenache and fortified with grape spirit. Resembling molasses in both color and texture, it is deeply evocative—a bottomless well of aroma and flavor that goes on and on: first chocolate, dates and praline, then baking spice and coffee beans, then tree sap, forest floor and the dusty spine of an old book. Intensely concentrated yet extraordinarily fresh, it is like drinking the essence of the past, a time in Australia just after WWI when hope was in the air. This is an exceptionally rare beauty that will outlive all of us.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Seppeltsfield 1920 100-Year Vintage Para Tawny Red (South Australia)

Description: All about radiance and finesse, this iconic Tuscan red has beguiling aromas of cedar, wild red berry, menthol and pipe tobacco that mingle with fragrant blue flowers. Made with 85% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Cabernet Franc, the focused, elegantly structured palate is vibrant and savory, delivering cassis, orange zest, licorice and a hint of coffee framed in taut, polished tannins. Bright acidity keeps it energized and balanced. Drink through 2033.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta San Guido 2018 Sassicaia  (Bolgheri Sassicaia)

Description: This is a blend of 74% Coonawarra Cabernet Sauvignon and 26% Barossa Shiraz. It's a sleek and polished yet approachable red that screams luxury. Waves of cherry, plum, licorice, graphite, savory spices and herbs are ensconced in a subtle yet present layer of oak and wound in ultrafine tannins. Drink 2023–2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2015 The Caley Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz

Description: Aromas of cassis, menthol, blue flower and pipe tobacco shape the nose on this gorgeous red. A blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, the delicious, elegantly structured palate delivers dried black cherry, ripe blackberry, licorice and vanilla framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2017 Tignanello Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost opaque in the glass, this hearty blend of 46% Tempranillo, 29% Malbec, 20% Petite Sirah and 5% Zinfandel begins with a burly nose of beef slathered in blueberry compote. The brawny qualities excel on the palate as well, which is full of rugged, leathery game, charred berry and dried mushroom flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2018 Praetorian Red (Templeton Gap District)

Description: Savory and enveloping, this red has aromas of woodland berry, Mediterranean scrub and menthol. The delicious, full-bodied palate doles out juicy black cherry, ripe blackberry and star anise before an espresso finish. Polished, velvety tannins lend finesse. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guado al Tasso 2017  Bolgheri Superiore

Description: New leather, camphor and cassis aromas emerge on this blend of 59% Cabernet Franc and 41% Merlot, along with whiffs of sweet pipe tobacco. Showing muscle but also surprising finesse, the delicious, full-bodied palate delivers ripe blackberry, Marasca cherry, licorice and grilled herbs alongside tightly knit, fine-grained tannins that envelope the rich flavors. While you might notice the warmth of alcohol on the close, you'd never guess the abv was 15.5%.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2018 Red (Toscana)

Description: Made with 72% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Sangiovese and 8% Cabernet Franc, this has aromas of black currant, menthol, Mediterranean herbs and spice. The palate offers dried black cherry, star anise, tobacco and toasted almond framed in tightly wound, close-grained tannins that produce a firm finish. This is already generous, but give the tannins a few years to unwind. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi Antinori 2017 Solaia Red (Toscana)

Description: With over two decades under its belt, this Tawny fortified defies its age. It's radiant burnt orange in hue, with an equally sunny disposition. High-toned aromas of candied citrus, flan, roasted nuts and a damp woodsy underbelly lead to a mouthfeel that's rich but not unctuous, sweet but not cloying. There's some heat from the alcohol but a wealth of primary citrus flavors that hint at many more years to come. A delicious tribute to Australia's most traditional winemaking style from one of its oldest wineries.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Seppeltsfield 1999 Vintage Para Tawny Red (South Australia)

Description: Made with Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, this has intense aromas of cassis, camphor, leather and dark spice. It's smooth and savory, doling out ripe blackberry, juicy black currant, licorice and tobacco accompanied by polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Biserno 2018 Il Pino di Biserno Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Edgar Torres manages to craft blends that both hit those Paso Robles rich marks yet exhibit zesty freshness as well. This blend of 54% Garnacha, 23% Carignan and 23% Tempranillo begins with aromas of crisp black raspberry, caramel and pepper dust on the nose, while the palate adds bright purple flowers and a stony minerality to the mix.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2018 Tarragona Paper Street Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: Fragrant, delicious and loaded with finesse, this radiant red from Alto Piemonte has enticing aromas of woodland red berries, baking spice, rose and wild herbs. Focused and vibrant, the lithe palate has a pristine quality, featuring juicy red cherry, blood orange, white pepper and a note of star anise framed in lithe tannins. Bright acidity keeps it energized. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Guelpa 2018 Red (Sizzano)

Appellation: Mendocino Ridge, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This quietly impressive wine wraps superfine tannins around deep, haunting flavors that range from ginger-spice cookies to cooked blueberries, new leather and dark chocolate. It's big in terms of flavor impact, but the wine itself is just medium to full bodied, and offers a silky, polished texture that's hard to resist. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Drew 2018 The Field Blend Red (Mendocino Ridge)

Description: Vines from La Brûlade, the highest point in Bandol at 1,200 feet, make this rich and dense wine. Perfumed and still packed with dark tannins to nourish the juicy black fruits, it is structured and concentrated. Drink from 2024. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Bégude 2018 La Brûlade Red (Bandol)

Description: This enticing red offers alluring aromas of fragrant purple flowers, dark-skinned berries and crushed mint. The elegantly structured palate doles out succulent blackberry, orange zest, licorice and saline notes set against taut, refined tannins. It's nicely balanced by fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta San Guido 2019 Guidalberto Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Falcone only produces 75 cases of this nonvintage, solera-style blend of Petite Sirah, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon each year. Lush and luxurious aromas of black-cherry cream, vanilla and caramel entice the nose, while the palate's creamy texture and rich flavors are balanced by ample acidity and a violet lift. It's a special sip every time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Falcone NV Annate XI Red (Paso Robles)

Description: The latest release of this wine honors the company's chief winemaker of 30 years, Louisa Rose. This is a lucid, multilayered wine that shows notes of dark cherry, currant, chocolate, mint, bay and peppery spices smudged with graphite. The palate is big and rich but tempered by fine, chalky tannins, with a tang to the fruit and an underbelly of roast meat. Drink 2022–2036.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yalumba 2016 The Signature Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (Barossa)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this blend of 67% Syrah, 31% Petite Sirah and 2% Zinfandel shows iodine and lamb aromas on the nose alongside charred black currant and hickory smoke. Those gamy, roasted qualities swirl throughout the sip, where firm acidity and a pinch of herbs complete the experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2018 Reckoning Red (Templeton Gap District)

Description: Nearly opaque in the glass, this blend of 47% Cabernet Sauvignon, 43% Petit Verdot and 10% Syrah entices the nose with rich yet somehow reserved aromas of violet, caramel and charred berry. It's thick and dense on the palate, with lavish tannins that are creamy and tense, framing elderberry, dark-cocoa, espresso-bean and floral flavors. Drink now through 2030.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Herman Story 2018 Bolt Cutter Red (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Extremely dark in the glass, this proprietary blend offers black currant, violet pastis, elderberry jam and cola on the nose. Lavish tannins massage the palate, where lush tones of violet and lavender meet with bay-leaf, wild-herb and heavier cassis and charred meat flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Cloak & Dagger 2018 Cryptology Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This blend of old-vine Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc is open and fragrant yet powerful and dense right from the get go. Concentrated damson plum and black currant are backed by notes of dark chocolate, licorice, eucalyptus and tomato leaf, with a sanguine nuance. The tannins are powerful and drying but hold the silky fruit neatly in place. Drink 2023–2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Henschke 2016 Keyneton Euphonium Red (Barossa)

Description: A blend from three parcels of vines planted within sight of the Lubéron mountains, this wine is structured, powerful and firm. It is dry at the core, circled by dark plum, toast and ripe tannins. The wine needs to age further, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paradis 2017 Terre des Anges Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The dark-berry aromas on this blend of 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Syrah and 14% Petit Verdot quickly slide into savory pastrami and roast beef scents. There is firm tension to the palate, where star anise and vanilla coat the black-plum and cassis flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2017 Sawbones Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Ripe aromas of stewed blackberry, mulberry and fig meet with loamy earth, iron and nutmeg on the nose of this Priorat-inspired blend of 75% Carignan, 12% Garnacha, 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Syrah. There is tension and freshness to the sip, where smashed boysenberry flavors are sprinkled with cardamom spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2018 Priorato Paper Street Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Syrah and its relative Petite Sirah make a delicious and well-behaved blend here. Exceptional ripeness and well-concentrated fruitiness mark this wine as something special. A deep color, dense blackberry and boysenberry flavors and moderate tannins all come together on a high level.                      Jim Gordon
Name: M2 2017 Duality Red (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Nearly black as night in the glass, this blend is ripe and rich on the nose, offering cassis, caramelized blackberry, cola, cocoa and mincemeat-pie aromas. A firm tannic structure manages to hold together the hefty palate, loaded with ripe blueberry and more baking spice. It's balanced right on the ledge for now.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bushong 2018 Power, Corruption & Lies Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: This is an unusual blend of 95% Petit Verdot with 5% Grenache. Aged in egg-shaped clay amphorae, it is ripe, with a dense texture that gives weight and open berry flavors. Drink this mature wine now. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Lauzières 2012 Sine Nomine Red (Vin de France)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Hearty aromas of baked plum and boysenberry are laced with star anise and clove on the nose of this unique blend of 80% Mourvèdre and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. It lands with force on the palate, offering rich and ripe purple fruit and barrel spices, from nutmeg to clove to oak, with tannins that stand firm on the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bodega de Edgar 2018 La Milla Paper Street Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: The smooth, rich and smoky texture of this massive wine brings out layers of black-plum fruits and tight acidity that adds juiciness. The wine's power is palpable, dense and set for much more aging. Drink from 2024.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Vignobles Marie Maria Grèvière  (Madiran)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This nod to the classic Australian Cab-Syrah blend hits the savory-fruity combination well. Aromas of thyme, white pepper, sage flowers and lavender meet with smashed plums and berries on the nose. The palate is lively with sharp pepper and bay leaf, set against the boysenberry core.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Biddle Ranch 2017 Akubra Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: Made with 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Cabernet Franc and 18% Merlot, this has aromas of cassis, French oak, leather and a whiff of bell pepper that waft out of the glass. Elegantly structured, the bright, linear palate offers black-skinned berries, licorice and coffee bean set against taut, fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Guado al Tasso 2018  Bolgheri Superiore

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Intricate baking-spice aromas meet vivid black-cherry and black-pepper flavors in this full-bodied and moderately tannic blend based on Petite Sirah and Cinsault. Cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg add complexity to the focused, layered fruit notes. Best through 2025.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2018 Jacks Are Wild Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This deep and concentrated wine from a consistent Livermore estate layers wonderful black-cherry, dark-chocolate, graphite and tobacco flavors on a full body braced by moderate, velvety tannins. Tempting to drink now but best after 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2016 Estate Meritage Red (Livermore Valley)

Description: The vineyard of the ancient monastery of Saint-Mont, now a luxury hotel, has produced this dense wine. With rich Tannat aided by Pinenc and Cabernet Sauvignon, the wine has richness and concentration. It is powerful and worth aging further. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2018 Monastère de Saint-Mont  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Polished aromas of dark yet savory fruits feature dried fig, black olive, scorched berry, black pepper and cocoa on the umami-laden nose of this blend of 74% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Syrah and 6% Graciano. The cured meat aspect comes through on the palate, where charred fruit and a hint of lilac flavor come through on the midpalate. Grippy tannins ensure a long evolution. Drink now through 2033.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Orion 2018 Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Made with 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Petit Verdot and 20% Cabernet Franc, this opens with heady aromas of ripe black-skinned berries, cedar and scorched earth. The concentrated, full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, clove, mocha and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brancaia 2017 Ilatraia Red (Toscana)

Description: Made with 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Sangiovese, this has enticing aromas of cassis, black tea, violet and wild herbs. Savory and elegantly structured, the medium-bodied palate shows ripe blackberry, star anise and a hint of coffee bean framed in lithe, polished tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta San Guido 2019 Le Difese Red (Toscana)

Description: A basket full of black-fruit and dried fruit flavors gives this full-bodied wine amazing breadth and richness, from black cherries to dried black figs and dark chocolate. Soft tannins and a mouthfilling texture keep it gentle on the palate despite much richness.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Prospect 772 2018 Black Tie Charlie Syrah-Petite Sirah (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of nine varieties, led by Petite Sirah and Grenache, is compellingly complex, starting with aromas of Luxardo cherry, black olive, charcoal and lavender on the nose. There is ample firmness to the palate, which unleashes waves of strawberry, cherry and tomato alongside pinches of thyme, oregano and marjoram.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Villa San-Juliette 2017 Chorum Reserve Small Lot Selection Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Earthy and savory, this enjoyable red opens with aromas suggesting underbrush, camphor and wild herbs. Showing the same earthy finesse as the nose, the palate is polished and tangy, doling out crushed raspberry, blood orange, star anise and truffle. Lithe tannins and bright acidity keep it fresh, taut and balanced. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria La Vialla 2019 Casa Conforto  (Chianti Superiore)

Appellation: Les Baux de Provence, Provence, France
Description: This ripe and mature wine celebrates Grenache. Ripe tannins, juicy blackberry fruits and a richly perfumed character come together in a dense texture and a spicy aftertaste. Drink the wine now. Organic and biodynamic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de Lauzières 2015 Equinoxe Red (Les Baux de Provence)

Description: It is extraordinary how two naturally tannic grapes, Malbec and Tannat, come together in a wine with a smooth and rounded texture. Four years have worked their wonder to give a wine that is rich with black fruits and tannins that have been completely tamed. Drink this full, ripe wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine du Prince 2017 Le Plaisir du Prince  (Cahors)

Description: Gritty, minerally aromas sit atop plum and raspberry scents on a spirited nose with campfire notes. This Malbec blend is crisp and bright, with tangy acidity reflective of the high altitude noted on the label. Red plum, raspberry and currant flavors finish with dry tannins, spice notes and a touch of rawness that should subside with more bottle age and/or airing; drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Doña Paula 2018 Altitude Series 1350 Red (Gualtallary)

Description: A blend of 69% Cabernet Franc, 23% Merlot and 8% Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with balsamic aromas of camphor, new leather and cedar that mingle with mature black-skinned fruit. Full-bodied and powerfully structured, the concentrated palate reflects the heat of the vintage, offering dried cherry, raisin, grilled sage and star anise alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Assertive, close-grained tannins clench the finish. Give it a few years to let the tannins unfurl.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Trinoro 2017 Red (Toscana)

Description: Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Grenache come together in this rich, generous wine typical of the appellation. With broad red fruits and acidity in balance, the wine is approaching maturity. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Paradis 2017 Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)

Description: Fragrant notes of black plum and tart black cherry abound in this full-bodied but zesty blend of Merlot (70%), Cabernet (20%) and Lemberger (10%). It's a smoky, delicately spiced red, accented by savory touches of tea leaf and a lingering violet perfume that is at peak now through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Schnaitmann 2017 Simonroth Cuvée D Red (Württemberg)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cedar and rosemary aromatics get this complex and distinctive Spanish-style blend off to a vivid start, before rich black-fruit, turned earth and tobacco nuances are revealed on the palate. Moderate tannins and full body support good concentration and depth.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2017 Estate Coccineous Red (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep aromas of blueberry and black currant are sleek and focused on the nose of this blend of 56% Grenache, 26% Tempranillo, 10% Mourvèdre, 5% Petite Sirah and 3% Malbec. Gritty tannins frame the palate, where charred yet bright fruit flavors are lifted by baking spice and zesty acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2018 Mad Crush Red (Templeton Gap District)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of black raspberry jam, sarsaparilla and lavender come through on the nose of this bold blend of 75% Grenache, 16% Tannat and 9% Syrah. Bay leaf, mace and clove flavors decorate the dark-berry core on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Old Creek Ranch 2018 El Camino Red (Central Coast)

Description: Aromas of tobacco, leather and wild berries form the nose along with earthy whiffs of truffle and violet. Made with organically farmed grapes, the lithe, elegant palate shows cassis, black cherry, baking spice and a hint of botanical herbs alongside fresh acidity and lithe, refined tannins. It finishes on a hint of black tea.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Masi 2016 Serego Alighieri Bell'Ovile Red (Toscana)

Description: Clos de los Siete almost never fails, and this version from a ripe and easy vintage is just that: ripe and easy. Inky blackberry and black currant aromas show a waft of campfire creosote, while this feels big and round, with plenty of mouth-blackening fruit. Oak-aided blackberry, cassis and chocolate flavors come with a hint of herbs, while the finish is smooth and mild. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Clos de los Siete 2018 By Michel Rolland Red (Uco Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and dark aromas of berry, plum, pie spice and lavender show on the nose of this blend of 57% Zinfandel from the Derby Vineyard and 43% Petite Sirah from Laura's Vineyard. The palate is lavish in rich fruit and spice flavors, but there is a firm tension as well as light violet and crushed gravel elements.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Derby 2016 The Maneater Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-black-plum, tar and mahogany aromas show on the initially subtle nose of this blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Sangiovese and 5% Petite Sirah. The tannins are firm on the sip, where rich blackberry flavors meet with a tarry minerality and ample licorice spice. Drink now through 2028.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Pianetta 2018 Tuscan Nights Red (Central Coast)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried mushroom, wood spice, anise and baked red-fruit aromas show on the nose of this blend of 81% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Syrah, 5% Petite Sirah and 3% Merlot. It's viscous on the palate at first, and then the tannins and acidity rise to meet the blue fruit and toasty oak flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tooth & Nail 2018 The Possessor Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Walla Walla Valley (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is made from 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Syrah, 14% Cabernet Franc, 7% Merlot and 2% Grenache. Aromas of café au lait, green herbs, raspberry and sweet baking spice lead to a center-focused palate full of dark chocolate flavors. It's light on its feet, with the grainy tannins backing it up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Métis 2018 Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))

Description: A blend of 85% Sangiovese and 15% Malvasia Nera, this has aromas of cedar, leather, French oak and a whiff of underbrush. Linear and on the lighter end of medium-bodied, the palate offers juicy Morello cherry, blood orange, coffee bean and ground clove before grainy tannins grip the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castellare 2016 I Sodi di San Niccolò Red (Toscana)

Description: This blend of Malbec, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Carignan is a satisfyingly rich, round and silky.The full-bodied, supple palate boasts flavors of black cherry, currant and blueberry alongside hints of game and tobacco.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Hess Collection 2018 Lion Tamer Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Lush aromas of roasted strawberry, crumpled herbs and sweet wood spice show on the nose of this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend, which also includes 10% each of Syrah and Petite Sirah. The dark-fruit, thyme and mint aspects of the palate are bolstered by acidity and chalky tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kukkula 2018 Iso Red (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Wonderful black-fruit flavors are matched by baking spices in this concentrated, balanced and velvet-textured wine. The tannins are very fine grained and the palate overflows with blueberry, blackberry and a hint of black pepper.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Parducci 2019 True Grit Reserve Red (Mendocino County)

Description: Black-fruit aromas are generous and pulpy, with a touch of graphite. This blend of 70% Malbec with Bonarda and Syrah feels plush and jammy, with modest acidity. Jammy blackberry flavors are ever so slightly herbal, while this is easygoing on the finish, a reflection of this blend in its entirety. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Trivento 2018 Amado Sur Red (Mendoza)

Description: A juicy, fruity blend of Mourvèdre, Grenache and Cinsault, this wine is lightly textured with soft tannins. The equivalent of a second wine for this estate, it focuses on ripe black fruits and fresh acidity. Drink from 2022. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine de la Bégude 2019 Cadet de la Bégude Red (Mediterranée)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an intriguing touch of nori to the nose of this blend of 58% Syrah, 37% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petite Sirah, as well as elderberry, forest shrub and cocoa aromas. Dried flowers and beet flavors come through on the dry, savory sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Kiamie 2016 Kiame Kuvée Red (Adelaida District)

Description: This blend of 64% Syrah, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon and 14% Merlot makes for a delightful pour. Aromas of baked black plum, cocoa and dried rose lead into a palate framed by rustic tannins that hold up those rich fruit flavors, with mace and clove adding spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma de Cattleya 2019 Red (Sonoma County)

Description: Black-skinned berry, underbrush and leather aromas emerge from the glass. The polished palate features dried black cherry, ground black pepper and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Supremus 2015 Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This attractive and vibrant blend of Barbera, Nebbiolo and Sangiovese is focused on red-cherry and raspberry flavors and braced by tangy acidity. Moderate tannins cleanse the palate for the next bite of a rich risotto or juicy lamb burger.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Las Positas 2016 Estate Patrinus Red (Livermore Valley)

Description: Broad, rich and mouthfilling, this full-bodied wine offers a tasty blend of ripe strawberry and raspberry flavors with stylish and light oak accents like ginger and nutmeg.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ryer Estate 2018 Red (California)

Description: Made with 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this has aromas of menthol, damp forest floor and leather before a violet note pops up. The linear, racy palate offers dried cherry, licorice and a hint of coffee bean alongside taut, close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Certosa di Belriguardo 2018  Chianti Classico

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This agile and complex wine emphasizes good balance and a tempting mélange of red-fruit flavors that are well braced by bright acidity and moderate tannins. The blend is more than half Cinsault plus four other grape varieties.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Starfield 2018 The Miner's Inch Red (El Dorado)

Description: This blend of 55% Petit Verdot, 25% Cabernet Franc and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of black-skinned berries, mocha and bell pepper. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, toasted oak and espresso alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Monteti 2015 Monteti Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Generous aromas of blackberry jam, root-beer spice, turned earth and rusty rocks show on the nose of this kitchen-sink blend of 23% Sangiovese, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Malbec, 17% Cabernet Franc, 9% Petit Verdot and 7% Petite Sirah. There's ample grip to the palate, which frames the thick black-plum and elderberry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Old Creek Ranch 2018 Fire Station Red (Central Coast)

Description: Made predominately from Limnio, with Mavrotragano and Mavroudi, this red blend offers aromas of plum, blackberry, olive and spice. On the palate, it's juicy but balanced, with flavors of black cherry, blackberry, spices and plum buoyed by bright acidity. The wine finishes long with a wave a of crushed herbs and olive.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Gerovassiliou 2013 Avaton Red (Epanomi)

Description: This full-bodied, ripe and mouthfilling wine is packed deeply with blueberry and blackberry flavors and wrapped in moderate tannins. Blended from Syrah, Carignan and Tempranillo, it's going to be great with a juicy steak or brisket.                      Jim Gordon
Name: M2 2017 Clockstoppers Red (California)

Description: Dominated by the local Négrette grape, this wine is perfumed, ripe with smooth tannins and juicy black fruits. The structure acts as a scaffolding for the fruitiness, ripeness and aging possibilities. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Clamens 2019 Red (Fronton)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A blend of 70% Tannat and 30% Malbec, this is a big fruit bowl of a wine, with mixed red berries, citrus and a slice of pineapple. The tannins are ripe but not dominant, and the acidity provides the right balance. It turns a bit stiff in the finish, but another year or two of bottle age should fix that.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Troon 2018 Cuvée Pyrénées Red (Applegate Valley)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Blending 85% Merlot with 15% Zinfandel, this likable red is brimming in strawberry, nutmeg and black licorice, while the tannins are supple and smooth. Sweet oak notes give it additional richness and length.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Covenant 2018 The Tribe Proprietary Red (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: In typical Penfolds style, this Cab, Shiraz blend is a rich, polished wine lacquered in high-end oak. Lurking beneath the barrel-driven furniture polish, mocha and spice notes is a plush layer of berry fruit and a minty, herbal nuance. The alcohol shows some warmth on the gauzy palate while woody tannins cinch the fruit. A wine for chewing rather than sipping, this will requite a mega amount of protein and several years in cellar. Drink 2023–2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Penfolds 2018 Bin 389 Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (South Australia)

Description: Certified organic and biodynamic, this has aromas of tilled earth, truffle, new leather and game. It has an earthy, almost rustic charm but is also savory, doling out juicy black cherry, fleshy raspberry, ground clove and charcuterie alongside polished, buffed tannins. Open a few hours ahead of time and you'll be rewarded. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria La Vialla 2018 Casa Conforto  (Chianti Superiore)

Description: A blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Merlot, this has aromas evoking Mediterranean scrub, cedar and black-skinned berries. The savory palate features blackberry jam, clove and black pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Buli 2016 Estate 44 Red (Toscana)

Description: Made with 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Alicante and 25% Merlot, this offers aromas recalling mature black-skinned fruit, tilled soil and a cedar. The ripe palate offers baked plum, tobacco and mocha alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Monteti 2015 Caburnio Red (Toscana)

Description: Sunbaked berry and prune aromas are ripe but sound, with a vanilla oak backing. A full palate with muscular tannins reflects a hot and dry vintage, while oaky spice and cocoa flavors dress up core black-fruit flavors. Warmth and ripeness are draped all over this value Rioja; drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Riojanas 2017 Monte Real Cuvée Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Strong and slightly sweet wood-spice aromas meet with baked black plum and nutmeg on the inviting nose of this bottling. Baking-spice flavors flow through the palate, which is loaded with baked mulberry fruit.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bushong 2018 Same Deep Water As You Red (Central Coast)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted strawberry aromas meet with anise and cedar on the nose of this blend of 50% Sangiovese, 40% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. There's a pleasant tannic grip to the sip, where red-plum and strawberry flavors are wrapped in balsam and woody oak.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Martin Ranch 2017 Therese Vineyards Privata Reserva Red (Santa Clara Valley)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes—65% Sangiovese, 30% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon—this has inviting aromas of black-skinned berries, tobacco and underbrush. The juicy palate offers fleshy black cherry, star anise and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute Lunelli 2016 Teuto Red (Costa Toscana)

Description: The base for this liquor is ruby fortified wine. It's steeped with chocolate and spices and fortified with brandy. The color of molasses, it smells and tastes like a coffee shop: café au lait, caramel and chocolate, with a slice of walnut and raisin cake on the side. While the palate is one dimensional, the texture is satiny and the flavors are well balanced. Drink with a similarly rich dessert like tiramisu or even as a spike to your coffee.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Kellermeister NV Sable Red (Barossa)

Description: This well-made blend leads with 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, adding in 33% Merlot and smaller amounts of Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Creamy in cassis and vanilla, it exudes brooding blueberry flavors that wrap around sage, leather and cigar, the tannins burly and thick.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chappellet 2018 Mountain Cuvée Proprietor's Blend Red (Napa County)

Description: Balsamic aromas of cedar, new leather and camphor mingle with whiffs of rose on this blend of Sangiovese and 10% other red grapes. On the tangy palate, notes of truffle, orange zest and carob accent a juicy black cherry core while polished tannins and tangy acidity provide pliant support. Drink through 2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Grignano 2015 Cardinal Enrico Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: Just south of the city of Condom, this ancient estate is now managed by this cooperative. A rich, dense, still stalky blend of Merlot and Syrah, this wine has layers of acidity, black-currant fruits and a smoky character. It is needs some time, so drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Domaine de Cassaigne Grand Vin Merlot-Syrah (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Very fruity, chocolaty and supersmooth, this full-bodied wine is not very tannic and simply floods the palate with rich berries and milk-chocolate flavors. Its seeming sweetness will help it pair with spicy meat and poultry dishes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Peirano 2019 Estate Vineyards Sea Enchantress Red (Lodi)

Description: Aromas of ripe red berries, cherry and spice are followed by rich flavors of cherry, currant and vanilla in this blend containing 50% Xinomavro, 30% Grenache and 20% Limnio. The wine offers good structure and a touch of smoke, with a lingering finish of fruit and spice. It's an ageworthy wine, at a good price.                      Susan Kostrzewa
Name: Tsantali 2014 Agiorgitiko Abaton Gold Selection Red (Mount Athos)

Description: Made with Sangiovese and a drop of Cabernet and Merlot, this has aromas of dark-skinned fruit, underbrush and baking spice. The medium-bodied palate shows ripe black plum, tangerine zest and sage alongside smooth tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Antico 2016 Red (Toscana)

Description: Enticing aromas of crushed mint, tilled earth, rose and graphite lead the way on this blend of 85% Sangiovese with Canaiolo Nero, Mammolo and Merlot. Made for sheer and immediate drinking pleasure, the smooth, easygoing palate offers juicy black cherry, star anise and a hint of charcuterie alongside lithe, pliant tannins and tangy acidity. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Salcheto 2019 Biskero  (Chianti)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: One of the many examples from this producer of rare grapes brought back to life, this is made from Manseng Noir blended with familiar Merlot. Rich in spicy tannins with a tight structure, the wine is ripe, full of dark black fruits and ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2019 Moonseng Red (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Made with 55% Sangiovese, 10% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon as well 15% other red grapes (Ciliegiolo, Colorino, Giacomino), this juicy red has aromas of wild berries and Mediterranean brush. Round and ready, the palate offers fleshy black cherry, star anise and a hint of olive brine framed in smooth tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Russo 2019 Ceppitaio Red (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This bottling combines an Atlantic grape with a Mediterranean grape into a harmonious whole. Still young, it's full of black fruits, blueberries, gentle tannins and acidity. Drink the wine from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Domaine de Cassaigne Le Labyrinthe Merlot-Syrah (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Made with Sangiovese and a small amount of Cabernet Sauvignon, this thoroughly enjoyable red opens with fruity aromas of wild berries and a whiff of just-pressed grapes. The easygoing palate offers juicy Marasca cherry and a hint of ground clove alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frescobaldi 2019 Remole Red (Toscana)

Description: Made with Sangiovese and Canaiolo, this easygoing red has aromas of ripe berries, leather and tilled earth. Extremely simple and easy drinking, the light palate suggests juicy cherry and ground clove alongside tangy acidity and relaxed tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Good 2018  Chianti

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals scorched earth, baking spice and tobacco leaf. The easygoing palate offers dark-skinned fruit and clove alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Piazzano 2019 Ventoso Red (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of wild red berries follow over to the fresh, easygoing palate along with a hint of ground clove. Light-bodied and extremely simple, this would make a pleasant pour for large, informal gatherings or for everyday fare.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gancia 2019  Chianti

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This wine is stalky, textured with smoky flavors and light tannins. Red cherries and black currants show strongly. Drink the wine from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2020 Colombelle Red (Côtes de Gascogne)

Description: Heavy oak spices and a sweet slant dominate this medium-bodied wine. Chocolate, vanilla and raisin flavors take the lead.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cocobon NV Red (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's incredible depth to this Rhône-forward blend, starting with aromas of dark boysenberry jam wrapped in pie crust, lavender-like flowers and the slightly nutty hint of charred chicken fat. Tannins leap out at first and then smooth into the palate soothingly, carrying dark-cherry, roasted berry and baking-spice flavors as well as a refreshing acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Epoch 2017 Estate Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Description: A blend of Charbono, Petite Sirah and Malbec, this red showcases the fine attributes of each, opening in crisp red and blue fruit before finding contrast in a swirl of grilled meat and mushroom. Graphite notes add to the savory earthiness and underlying spiciness; the palate is boosted throughout by lively acidity.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Matt Morris 2018 Heritage Blend Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles Willow Creek District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark aromas of espresso- spiked cassis meet with charred violets on the bold yet beautiful nose of this blend of 56% Petite Sirah, 16% Mourvèdre, 15% Syrah and 13% Grenache. That coffee, black-currant and purple-flower combination carries into the sip as well, where the structure ensures long-term enjoyment. Drink now until 2032.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Epoch 2017 Ingenuity Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: In comparison to some of the brand's other offerings, this is an affordable way to check in on the Daou experience. Savory aromas of coffee bean meet with lush purple fruits on the nose. The palate is rounded in texture, with rich flavors of dark berry, cappuccino, milk chocolate and caramel.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Daou 2018 Bodyguard Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Loads of carnations and other red-flower-potpourri aromas meet with crisp and tart plum, a hint of caramelized berries and a touch of sagebrush on the nose of this blend of 59% Grenache, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon and 18% Tempranillo. Fine-grained tannins and a slow-simmering, underlying acidity wrap up the dried sage and rustic fruit flavors of the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Benom 2018 Les Deux Freres Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Ripe blackberry and dark plum aromas are dense and full as they veer toward raisin, while this feels stocky and deep, with beneficial edginess to the well-structured palate. Dark chocolate, coffee, vanilla and easygoing spice flavors sit atop the core blackberry and cassis, while this is smooth and silky on a finish with licorice and chocolate notes that ride on for a while. Drink this comfortably ripe and pure red blend through 2027.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Carolina 2017 VSC Red (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Ripe black plum and berry aromas are full and heady, while this blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon along with Carmenère and Syrah is brightened by healthy acidity. Spicy yet fully ripe berry and currant flavors are backed by earthy tomato and tobacco notes on a smooth finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Court Rollan Filius Blend de Blends
Name: Casas del Toqui 2018 Court Rollan Filius Blend de Blends Red (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark aromas of blueberry and dried carnation pick up a toasty tone on the nose of this blend of 46% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Primitivo and 12% Merlot. The smooth palate is well integrated, showing crushed slate minerality, dark berry, plum and dried fennel atop a chiseled structure.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Sculpterra 2018 Figurine Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Briary blackberry and cassis aromas include familiar Chilean notes of eucalyptus and juniper. This Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant blend is ripe and creamy in feel, with generous flavors of brown sugar, herbs, blackberry, cassis, coffee and chocolate. The finish is chewy and rich. Drink now–2025.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Vik 2017 Milla Cala Millahue Red (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: A tightly built nose deals pointy aromas of tobacco, green herbs, eucalyptus and black fruits, all common scents for Chile's best red wines. What makes this different than most is that it's a blend of Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot, a marriage rarely seen. Racy acidity and gripping tannins give this all the structure it needs, while spicy flavors of herb, blackberry and chocolaty oak turn ever so slightly more green on a powerful finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodega Volcanes de Chile 2017 Ígneo Red (Central Valley)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Iberian grapes excel in Southern California, as this Tempranillo-led blend (with 25% Petite Sirah and 2% Merlot) reveals. Deep blueberry paste, smoke, leather and cocoa aromas lead into a palate loaded with flavors of coffee-crusted smoked meats, rich black fruits and lingering tannins on the vanilla finnish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2017 Evenfall Red (Los Angeles County)

Description: Rich, lush blackberries and raspberries meet subtle black-pepper, cocoa and beef jus flavors in this full-bodied, nicely polished wine made from Petite Sirah, Zinfandel and Petit Verdot. It's mouthfilling, rounded and plump, backed by velvety, smooth tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2018 Sol Red (Lodi)

Description: Patented Chilean aromas of herbas, blackberry and dark plum are spicy and feature a fair amount of oak and related wood smoke. On the palate, this Cabernet Sauvignon-driven blend is juicy and high in energy. Plum, currant and wild berry flavors maintain a sense of freshness on the finish. Overall, this is showy and complex. Best from 2022 to 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Errazuriz 2017 Don Maximiano Founder's Reserve Red (Aconcagua Valley)

Description: Typical Chilean aromas of eucalyptus, green tobacco, tomato leaf and spicy berry fruits lead to a layered palate with moderate acidity. The palate brings flavors of prune, chocolate, baking spice and coffee grounds, while a lightly herbal finish is warm and ripe, with coffee, mocha and dried berry flavors. Drink in the near term.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Baron Philippe de Rothschild 2018 Baronesa P. Red (Maipo Valley)

Description: Firm but fine-grained tannins give this full-bodied wine, based on 80% Syrah, a good, grippy mouthfeel that supports gorgeous black-fruit flavors and hints of cocoa and cedar. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2018 Zeitlos Red (Lodi)

Description: A warm nose features a mixture of cheesy oak, brambly spice, foresty hints and bold black fruit scents. The palate on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Syrah is flush, with gravelly tannins and some heat. Balsamic dark-berry flavors show hints of eucalyptus and juniper, while a flavor-packed finish rumbles along on the heels of grating tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Siegel 2017 Unique Selection Los Lingues Red (Colchagua Valley)

Description: This elegant Aglianico starts off with bright aromas of pressed violet, red berries and Mediterranean scrub. There's a polished vibe to the palate, where glossy tannins frame pulsing cranberry and cherry flavors. It's accessible now but should hold well through 2028.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Cantine del Notaio 2017 L'Atto Red (Basilicata)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this blend of 52% Petite Sirah, 36% Tannat and 12% Tempranillo shows charred meat, singed violet and roasted berry aromas on the nose. It's very savory in the glass, with roasted coffee, grilled meat and blistered berry flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Daou 2018 Unbound Reserve Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted black-plum and boysenberry aromas meet with cola spice on the smoky nose of his bottling. Rich, lush tannins frame flavors of blackberry sauce, butterscotch and fudge on the palate, where acidity keeps the ripeness in check.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2017 Proprietary Red (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very dark in the glass, this blend of 71% Petite Sirah, 19% Tannat and 10% Petit Verdot offers a violet liqueur aromas along with cassis, vanilla and caramel tones. Deep blueberry flavors make for a hearty palate, where firm tannins carry into a lavender finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: MCV 2018 Black Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Very focused and well structured, this firmly tannic wine packs in well-concentrated black-cherry, cranberry and black-olive flavors that give it a real Tuscan personality. It's ripe but also muscular and will pair beautifully with rich meats and risottos. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sottomarino 2016 Sopraffino Red (Lake County)

Description: Herbal and berry aromas are saucy and a touch green, with hints of baking spice. This Cabernet Sauvignon blend includes 12% Syrah and feels full, saturated and dense. Plum, currant, tomato and herbal flavors are common for Chile, while this shows some oak grain and mild oxidation on a finish that tastes tomatoey, earthy and herbal. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casas del Toqui 2018 Court Rollan Genus Alto Totihue Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cassis and blueberry-sauce aromas meet with light purple flowers and crème brûlée on the nose of this blend of 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 39% Syrah, 10% Tempranillo and 6% Cabernet Franc. Extracted and lush on the palate, the wine is loaded with those same dark-fruit elements as well as touches of chocolate sauce.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Four Lanterns 2018 Kharis Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tart and roasted cranberry aromas meet with loamy soil and wild desert herbs on the nose of this blend of 64% Mourvèdre, 14% Zinfandel, 12% Grenache and 10% Counoise. There's an eclectic mix of fresh red fruit, dried herbs, light pepper and crushed brick flavors on the palate, which makes for an easy-drinking table wine.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Thacher 2017 Controlled Chaos Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Actor Kyle MacLachlan has another hit with this wine. Cabernet Sauvignon makes up 65%, with 18% Merlot and 17% Syrah. Aromas of cherry, vanilla and baking spice are followed by creamy, luscious fruit and barrel flavors that continue intertwining on the finish. It brings unabashed hedonism while maintaining lovely balance. There's a lot of value to be had.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Pursued by Bear 2017 Bear Cub Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost opaque in the glass, this blend of 61% Petite Sirah, 15% Tannat, 9% Syrah, 8% Grenache, 6% Petite Verdot and 1% Viognier offers deep violet and cassis aromas, but remains reserved. Elderberry and lavender flavors are spiced by cracked pepper on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: MCV 2018 1105 Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This aged cuvée is likably smooth, rich and well integrated, with a velvety plushness that appeals. Red and black cherry, mocha and traces of vanilla mingle around a soft core of full-bodied ripeness and moderate structure.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Eighty-Five Fifty-Five Reserve Red (Sonoma County)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From the producer's biodynamic estate, this blends 60% Sangiovese and 40% Barbera from two sites. Dark cherry, strawberry and raspberry are buoyed by fresh, focused acidity that keeps it lively and persistent, leading to a well-integrated, succulent finish.                      Virginie Boone
Designation: Altobasso Hawk Mountain and Valladares Estate Vineyards
Name: DaVero 2016 Altobasso Hawk Mountain and Valladares Estate Vineyards Red (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted blackberry, charred blueberry and smoked meat aromas waft toward the nose in this brawny bottling. It's viscous, slightly waxy and rich on the sip, full of açaí, cassis and more smoked meat flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Fess Parker 2018 The Big Easy Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost opaque in the glass, this blend of 61% Petite Sirah, 15% Tannat, 9% Syrah, 8% Grenache, 6% Petite Verdot and 1% Viognier offers deep violet and cassis aromas, but remains reserved. Elderberry and lavender flavors are spiced by cracked pepper on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: MCV 2018 1105 Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Plum, tomato and peppery spice aromas amount to a medium-weight nose. On the palate, this Cabernet Sauvignon blend offers tomatoey punch, while saucy berry, plum and tomato flavors are take on an herbal edge before petering out on a composed but slightly soft finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Andes Plateau 2018 700 High Altitude Red (Chile)

Description: This is a blend of 38% Sangiovese, 36% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Syrah and 4% Petite Sirah sourced from across the appellation. Bold, brawny and thick in berry flavors and tannins, it offers accents of dried herbs, toasted oak and game.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Pazzo 2018 Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Costières de Nîmes, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Notes of freshly cracked pepper and char introduce this spicy, smoldering blend of Syrah (80%) and Mourvèdre (20%). Matured in 20% new oak, it's a bold, concentrated wine that balances ripe black-currant and mulberry flavors against heady tones of spice, dried garrigue and scorched earth. Complex yet juicy, it's should drink well through 2028 at least.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Château Guiot 2018 Numa Syrah-Mourvèdre (Costières de Nîmes)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a sleekly packaged blend of Tempranillo, Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah, offering well-woven aromas of blackberry jam, light cocoa and balsam on the nose. It's a big, hearty sip, showing bramble and blackberry fruit as well as thyme, mocha and forest-floor flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Croma Vera 2018 Revelación Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This silky textured wine based on Petit Verdot grapes offers plenty of plum and blackberry flavors that seem to melt on the palate as light, polished tannins soothe with every sip. Delicious, pure fruit flavors are just lightly accented by baking spices.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2018 Blue Red (Lodi)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend overdelivers for the price, offering savory aromas of smoke and meat drippings on the nose as well as roasted blackberry and strawberry. The palate carries the savory edge forward, showing dried and roasted meat flavors as well as cracked pepper and hoisin sauce.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Now Presenting... 2018 Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Spicy berry aromas are lightly green and herbal, which is in accordance with Chilean norms. A dense palate is on the thick and creamy side, with chewy tannins. Herb, blackberry, plum and cassis flavors are heavy and jammy on the finish. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: TerraNoble 2018 Lahuen Red (Central Valley)

Description: This is a fascinating blend of two rich, structured grapes. The result is a dense wine with plenty of solid tannins as well as rich black fruits. Just approaching maturity, the wine has concentration and the power to age further. Drink now or wait until 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Sanguinhal 2016 Red (Lisboa)

Appellation: Vin de Pays du Gard, Rhône Valley, France
Description: Cabernet Sauvignon is a rarity in the Costières de Nîmes, but Mas des Bressades relies on 70-year-old Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah vines to make this robust red. Exceptionally ripe this vintage, its black-currant and cherry flavors are concentrated yet angular, edged by graphite and fine, gripping tannins. Aged one year in oak, it lingers on notes of cedar and sweet spice. It offers incredible value for an elegant red, at peak now through 2030.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Mas des Bressades 2017 Les Vignes de Mon Pere Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Vin de Pays du Gard)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This 10-variety blend, led by Syrah, Zinfandel, Cabernet Sauvignon and Grenache, begins with black raspberry, peppercorn, charred meat and asphalt on the nose. The palate's pleasant boysenberry jam core is balanced by fennel and clove spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: McClean 2019 Love Blend Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This big, mouthfilling and generous wine blended from mostly Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Barbera shows delicious ripeness and plenty of blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors on a full body supported by nicely integrated tannins. It's broad, easy and luscious to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Miraflores NV Rojo Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Charred black-cherry and tangy black-plum-skin aromas are heavily dosed with oaky spice on the nose of this blend. The palate is loaded with star anise, mace and more baking spices, framed by tightly woven tannins and full of roasted dark fruits.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek 2017 Vardande Red (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Pressed black-plum and boysenberry aromas meet with lightly toasted coconut on the nose of this blend of 41% Petit Verdot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 24% Syrah. It's quite jammy on the palate, loaded with blackberry preserves on buttered toast as well as flavors of violet and grape Skittles.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Law 2017 First Tracks Red (Adelaida District)

Description: This aged, small-production wine blends 75% Cabernet Sauvignon with 21% Petit Verdot and 4% Cabernet Franc. Together, they offer waxy cherry and plum notes within a reductive environment of herbes de Provence, tar and iron. The weight of the wine is thick and concentrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Raymond 2015 Salon Privé Red (Napa Valley)

Description: Rarely seen outside sparkling, Rada consists of 66% Pinot Meunier with 34% Pinot Noir. The color of strawberry juice, it opens with a reductive funk that eventually blows off with air. Underneath lie fruit aromas akin to watermelon and strawberry Jolly Ranchers that morph into orange rind, sap and spice with time. The palate is juicy-fruited and fresh, with tingly acidity and skinsy tannins. A glou-glou wine for chilling down and knocking back.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Stargazer 2019 Rada Red (Tasmania)

Description: This red from a mountain site is a blend of 65% Syrah, 23% Petite Sirah and 12% Grenache. It is hearty in flavors of smoked meat and oak, with a burly core of black fruit, iron and crushed rock.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Louis M. Martini 2017 Monte Rosso Vineyard Mountain Red (Sonoma Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Syrah makes up 88% of this wine, with the balance equal parts Malbec and Petit Verdot. Dark chocolate, dried green herb, vanilla and char aromas are followed by lively red and black fruit flavors with plentiful barrel accents.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Alki 2018 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This handsomely spicy wine offers a wide range of cedar, balsam, vanilla and toast flavors to complement ripe but bright black-cherry flavors. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and well balanced for its size.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Testa Vineyards 2017 Black X Dieci Red (Mendocino)

Description: Although quite firm with tannins, this full-bodied blend of traditional California grape varieties fills out its structure nicely with ripe blackberry and black-pepper flavors. Based on Zinfandel, it's a robust wine that will make a great pairing with grilled meats and the like. Best from 2023.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2019 Three Valleys Red (Sonoma County)

Description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Primitivo starts off with aromas of freshly pressed cherry and blackberry on the nose. Accents of tar, iodine and crushed gravel chime in. It's plush and full on the palate, but well honed by juicy acidity and crunchy tannins. For a full-bodied red that will also play well at the dinner table, look no further.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tenuta Parco dei Monaci 2015 Spaccasassi Red (Matera)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Deep and polished aromas of blackberry, minty chocolate and wood spice show on the nose of this blend of 44% Malbec, 14% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Tannat, 14% Carignan and 14% Merlot. Cedar and sandalwood spices pop on the palate, where tart black-plum sauce and espresso-bean flavors mesh.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2018 Insider Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This Aglianico offers aromas of wild strawberry, cherry, violet, pink peppercorn and juniper, making it both fruity and savory. There's polish and poise to the coiled berry fruit on the palate, where it feels both concentrated yet lifted by bright acidity and a tangy crushed-stone element. There's a glossy sheen to the tannins, making this approachable in its youth.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Macarico 2018 Rosso del Vulcano Red (Basilicata)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is almost equal parts Cabernet Franc (51%) and Malbec. The aromas suggest notes of cedar, coffee, citrus and cherry. Tangerine peel and plum flavors follow, bringing pleasing purity and plushness. The tannins give a light squeeze. It's a lot of wine for the money. Give it a short decant and pair it with grilled lamb shank.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Intrinsic 2018 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Syrah makes up 42% of this wine, with the rest equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. The aromas offer notes of coffee, cedar and black cherry. The palate brings a lot of elegance in the flavors with pleasing structure surrounding them.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Baer 2017 Callisto Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This fruity, generous and smooth-textured wine is a crowd-pleaser. Fresh and nicely saturated black-cherry and blackberry flavors fill the palate, backed by ultrasmooth tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Girasole 2019 Charlie's Blend Red (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Lively and crisp in balance, this black- and red-cherry scented blend of Syrah and Petite Sirah offers accents of black currants and sour cherries for a vivid, fruity palate and moderately tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2017 Espion Red (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah offers rich aromas of cocoa, anise and brandy dipped cherries on the nose. There's breadth and weight to the rather full palate, with plush cherry and blue fruit wrapped in a firm yet well-balanced oaky embrace. Brandy dipped fruit shows its face more on the finish. While the oak is prominent, there's decent balance from the fruit, bright acidity and polished tannins.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Taverna 2018 Il Lagarino Red (Basilicata)

Description: This big, bold blend of Malbec and Cabernet Franc is nicely ripe and concentrated and shows moderate tannins for a grippy mouthfeel. Deep black-cherry and black-olive notes give plenty to chew on but the structure needs time to mellow. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Alder Springs 2017 13 Tasks Red (Mendocino)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Tart black plum and hints of juniper, mint and pine show on the slightly tangy nose of this blend of 37% Zinfandel, 25% Petite Sirah, 18% Grenache, 15% Syrah and 5% Merlot. It's fairly light bodied on the palate, where sagebrush flavors meet with more black plum that's both tart and candied.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2018 Undertake Red (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This hearty but smooth and mellow wine dominated by Aglianico grapes complements good plummy flavors with light meaty, savory notes that give it a tasty complexity. It tastes authentic, interesting and not overtly fruity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Iron Hub 2017 Resolute Red (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Dark raspberry, red fruit and herb intermingle on the aromas. The flavors are pure and nimble. Pair it with grilled eggplant.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Adrice 2018 Cabbera Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is straight down the fairway, with its aromas of cherry, baking spice, raspberry and dried herbs. The flavors are restrained in style, pure and bright, with a tart finish. Pizza anyone?                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Category 5 NV Firewall Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Rustic aromas of blackberry sauce, lightly cracked pepper, crushed stone and crumpled oregano make for an invitingly complex nose for this bottling. There's a bitter herb touch to the palate, where black plum meets with teriyaki, leather and coffee-bean flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Wilson Creek NV Ecclesia Red (Temecula Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is straight down the fairway, with its aromas of cherry, baking spice, raspberry and dried herbs. The flavors are restrained in style, pure and bright, with a tart finish. Pizza anyone?                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Category 5 NV Firewall Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Despite approaching a decade of age, this Bordeaux-style red blend, with a kick of Syrah, is still in good shape. Blistered currant and cracked pepper lead into a woody palate of mahogany and prune, with roasted black-plum and mocha flavors as well.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2012 Los Olivos Red (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Abundant black-fruit flavors meld with black pepper and black olives in this flavorful and just slightly sweet wine. Blended from multiple vintages of the estate's Zinfandel, it's full bodied, dramatic in flavor and smooth in mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jaxon Keys NV JaxZin Estate Red (Mendocino)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Vanilla aromas are out front, followed by notes of wood spice, plum and cherry. Fruit and barrel intertwine on the palate, with lightly grainy tannins backing it up. It's a straightforward, enjoyable quaffer.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2017 Indian Wells Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Zinfandel-led blend, which also includes 17% Petite Sirah, 9% Syrah and 4% Grenache, begins with aromas of black plum that are tart at first and then jammier. It's rich and tannic on the sip, where roasted red and black fruits lead into an oak-kissed, cappuccino-cream finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Chronic Cellars 2019 Purple Paradise Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Effusive oak aromas and flavors give this attention-getting wine a very spicy profile, from scents of vanilla, cedar and graphite to flavors of black-cherry jam, cinnamon and oak char backed by velvety tannins.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Josh Cellars 2018 Family Reserve Red (Lodi)

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of 66% Syrah, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Franc (which features the famous Hollywood mountain lion on its awesome label), is tangy on the nose, with black-plum-skin, potpourri and milk-chocolate aromas. The sip is also tart, with sharp fruit tones, leading into a vanilla and crème brûlée finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2016 Ghost Cat Red (Los Angeles County)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This attractive, full-bodied wine makes a nice blend of fresh, jammy fruit flavors and subtle accents of herbs, olives and oak spices. It feels dry, smooth and just barely tannic, supporting raspberry, blackberry and light toast and vanilla notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Lapis Luna 2018 Red (North Coast)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy black-plum aromas lead the nose on this bottling, which is tart despite the dark color. The palate picks up intriguing notes of mace and violet, which balance the tangy roasted plum qualities.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Jalama 2018 El Capitan Red (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well-integrated oak spices like vanilla and cinnamon and vivid, juicy red-fruit flavors are easy to appreciate in this medium-bodied, not-very-tannic wine. Made from Sangiovese and Merlot, its underlying acidity gives a brisk feel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Campione Grand Reserve Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An unusually dark color and aromas of charcoal and rubber tire give this full-bodied wine a sort of pungent appeal at first whiff. Then, smoky, oaky flavors are backed by potent blackberry flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cinnabar 2018 Mercury Rising Red (Central Coast)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Tangy black-cherry and cola flavors fill out a medium body in this concentrated and polished blend of Tempranillo and Grenache. It brings out light tones of balsamic on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Quijote Grand Reserve Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark and viscous in the glass, this blend of Petite Sirah, Syrah and Grenache offers aromas of purple-flower potpourri followed by dark waves of burned caramel, brown sugar and extracted berry fruits. The brown-sugar and maple tones wrap up the gooey fruitcake and prune flavors of the palate, which also shows a hint of charred meat.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hunt Cellars 2014 Que Sirah Syrah Destiny Vineyard Red (Paso Robles)

Description: Thick dried fruit flavors and a vein of sweet-seeming oak give this full-bodied wine a big presence. Soft tannins meld with dried plum and chocolate flavors for an indulgent palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jamieson Ranch 2018 Whiplash Red (California)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Cranberry and strawberry aromas meet with turned earth and butterscotch on the nose of this blend of 83% Merlot, 10% Malbec, 5% Zinfandel and 2% Grenache. The mouthfeel is suave, offering roasted black-plum and baking-spice flavors, becoming viscous and a bit ripe by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Three Sides 2018 Red (Central Coast)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Concentrated and polished, this full-bodied blend offers vibrant but well-aged black-fruit flavors on a moderately tannic texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Xpealidocious Grand Reserve Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Well-concentrated black-cherry and cranberry flavors fill out this lively and polished blend of Alicante Bouschet, Petite Sirah and Zinfandel for a tangy, vivid impression. Moderate tannins give it a grippy finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Crystal Basin Cellars 2017 Inkonic Grand Reserve Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are quite green, with notes of garden herbs, green flower and tangerine along with smoke accents. Broad, but still light, quite smoky flavors follow.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Simply... 2017 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Prickly red berry aromas are herbaceous and briary. On the palate, this feels bright and alert, with inward-pulling tannins. A slight chemical note infiltrates herbal and berry flavors, while this pops with juicy acidity on a drawing finish. This Bolivian blend includes Merlot, Cab Sauvignon and Syrah.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas y Viñedos de La Concepción 2018 La Concepción Red (Bolivia)
Winery: Bodegas y Viñedos de La Concepción

Description: With its dry texture and firm edge, this wine has plenty of structure and not quite so much fruit. It is still tough, spicy with acidity that hasn't integrated.                      Roger Voss
Name: Sanguinhal 2016 Red (Lisboa)

Description: An earthy, sawdusty aroma leads to obvious oak flavors like toast, char and Bourbon in this full-bodied and rather tannic wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ghostrunner 2019 Ungrafted Red (Lodi)

Description: Minty green aromas include juniper notes and forced unnatural oak. A bouncy palate rides on racy acidity, while rough tannins make for a coarse mouthfeel. Graphite, mint, oak grain and brambly berry and plum flavors finish with heat and a blast of menthol.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Oveja Negra 2019 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Colchagua Valley)

Description: Jumbled aromas of pyrazines and creamy oak lead to a narrow, underdeveloped palate. Saucy plum and green notes are the key flavors on this Bolivian Tannat-Merlot blend that offers next to nothing on the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Aranjuez 2018 Duo Tannat-Merlot (Bolivia)

Description: Stalky, gritty aromas are murky, briary and suggestive of mealy green herbs and juniper. Herbal, murky, green flavors amount to a stewy whole, while this odd blend of Marselan, Tannat and Merlot finishes baked, green and earthy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Familia Traversa 2018 Noble Alianza Reserva Marselán-Tannat-Merlot Red (Uruguay)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Truffle, tilled earth, rose, camphor and star anise aromas slowly take shape on the nose of this elegantly structured red. Radiant and savory, the bright, focused palate showcases juicy Morello cherry, strawberry compote and ground cinnamon before a licorice close. Tightly wound, refined tannins and fresh acidity keep it balanced and give it an ageworthy structure. Drink 2024–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Contucci 2016 Mulinvecchio  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, this compelling wine opens with enticing aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, new leather, pipe tobacco and menthol. Chewy and delicious, the palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and baking spice framed in firm, refined tannins. It's full bodied, with a weightless elegance and a crushed mint finish. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello dei Rampolla 2016 d'Alceo Red (Toscana)

Description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot, this delicious, juicy red offers inviting aromas of new leather, blue flower, ripe black-skinned fruit and grilled herb.
