On the smooth, savory palate, tightly knit, fine-grained tannins seamlessly support fleshy black cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and tobacco before closing on a mocha note. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello dei Rampolla 2017 Sammarco Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Truffle, rose, new leather and menthol aromas shape the enticing nose along with scents of forest berry. Delicious and loaded with finesse, the smooth, taut palate delivers succulent red cherry, crushed strawberry, star anise and baking spice while firm, refined tannins provide noble support. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2024–2036.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Contucci 2016 Pietra Rossa  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: The longer Napa winemaker Chris Carpenter spends in McLaren Vale, the more in tune he seems to be with the country's palate and the region's unique terroirs. This is a precise and highly age worthy example of Oz's most famed red blend. Fleshy plum and blueberry fruit mingles with mint and other dried herbs, chocolate, bay leaf and peppery spice. The barrel influence is there too, but it's better integrated than in the past. At the moment the palate is a beast, with oodles of fruit and spice and muscular, chalky tannins, but there's chisel, finesse and a lengthy finish—all the trimmings of a harmonious wine set for the long haul. Drink until 2040.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hickinbotham 2018 The Peake Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark aromas of charred black currant and black plums meet with pepper dust, game and charcoal on the nose of this blend of 53% Syrah, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Grenache. These young wines need plenty of time to open up, but once this does, there are flavors of rich red fruits, peppery spices and dark chocolate that shifts from slightly bitter to comforting by the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Clos Solène 2018 Fleur de Solene Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark black-currant and baking-spice aromas float atop a subtle sense of rugged charred meat and tar on the compelling nose of this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 46% Mourvèdre and 4% Syrah. Tar and charcoal flavors show on the sip alongside dark-purple fruits and flowers, with a touch of dried herbs. Still young, but it will age gracefully.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Benom 2018 Muze Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of plum, violet and tobacco are front and center along with a whiff of camphor on this fragrant, savory red. The smooth, enveloping palate has a weightless quality, featuring spiced blueberry, dried cherry and licorice framed in tightly knit but elegant tannins. Drink through 2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Salcheto 2016 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, menthol and French oak form the alluring nose. On the firm, full-bodied palate, tightly knit, close-grained tannins accompany ripe Marasca cherry, orange zest, roasted coffee bean and star anise. It's densely structured but also has a weightless vibrancy. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poliziano 2017 Asinone  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: "The Peake" is an American (Chris Carpenter)'s ode to the classic Aussie red blend. 2017 was a fairly cool vintage and it shows here. More elegant, lucid and fruit driven than the '18, this may not age as long but it's drinking pretty darn well now. Notes of cherries, blueberries, licorice, violets and Chinese five spice are wound in sappy, savory tannins that have lovely texture and integration. A powerful but harmonious wine that should age gracefully until 2035.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hickinbotham 2017 The Peake Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Full bodied and savory, this lovely wine opens with aromas of wild cherry, camphor, sunbaked earth and baking spice. It's smooth and delicious, doling out juicy black cherry, ripe plum, cinnamon and white pepper. Polished, enveloping tannins provide elegant support while a licorice note lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Dei 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: It must be challenging to make nontraditional red blends that stand out in a lineup, but the French-born Fabre brothers are doing just that. This blend of 48% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Syrah and 17% Carignan starts with aromas of oregano, marjoram, baked earth and black plums. The palate picks up the herbal tones, then delivers dark-chocolate, smoked beef and black-currant flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Benom 2018 Hoc Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Clara Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh aromas of cassis, licorice, cocoa and a hint of toasted wood show on the nose of this blend of 53% Petite Sirah, 44% Syrah, 2% Mourvèdre and 1% Grenache. Firm tannins present dark-fruit flavors along with cocoa and coffee cream, yet it's the persistent acidity that keeps the wine elegant, all the way through the lavender-kissed finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Aver Family Vineyards 2017 Faith Red (Santa Clara Valley)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of dark-skinned berry, star anise and a whiff of leather form the nose on this blend of Sangiovese and 10% Colorino. Medium bodied and rather austere, the linear palate features dried Marasca cherry, white pepper and ground clove alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Boscarelli 2017 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: A blend of 80% Sangiovese, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this has heady aromas of cassis, spice, menthol and rose. Elegantly structured and savory, the taut, enveloping palate features ripe Marasca cherry, licorice and espresso set against polished, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Boscarelli 2017 Sotto Casa Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Vanilla-soaked-cherry aromas are remarkably subtle and pinpointed on the nose of this blend of 29% Carignan, 29% Petite Sirah, 21% Merlot, 14% Zinfandel and 7% Cabernet Sauvignon, which also shows star anise and mace scents. There's a flash of acidity on the tip of the sip and then tannins envelop the palate, delivering black-currant and blackplum flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Écluse 2018 Improv Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This is a blend of 78% Napa Valley- and Sonoma-grown Cabernet Sauvignon and 22% Shiraz from Paso Robles. It is a smooth and earthy wine that offers flavors of leather, earth, iron and crushed rock cut against herbal accents.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Penfolds 2018 Bin 600 Cabernet-Shiraz (California)

Description: This is a blend of 78% Napa Valley- and Sonoma-grown Cabernet Sauvignon and 22% Shiraz from Paso Robles. It is a smooth and earthy wine that offers flavors of leather, earth, iron and crushed rock cut against herbal accents.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Penfolds 2018 Bin 600 Cabernet-Shiraz (California)

Description: This is a ripe, fleshy, bombastic GSM with a nose you could dive into like the deep end of a swimming pool, backstroking in milk chocolate, ripe blueberries, violets, and lined with baking spice, ground pepper and cedar. The palate is rich, almost viscous, in texture. There's a woodiness amidst oodles of juicy, slippery fruit and chiseled tannins. Broad shouldered, with a good lick of alcohol, this is a high octane wine that somehow also achieves some elegance and approachability. Drink now–2028.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Powell & Son 2017 Red (Barossa)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: All about elegance, this fragrant red offers lovely scents of blue flower, forest berry, dark spice and a woodsy whiff of cedar. The lithe, savory palate delivers raspberry compote, wild cherry and licorice framed in taut, fine-grained tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it nicely balanced. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gracciano della Seta 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: From an estate managed by the Plaimont cooperative, this wine is mature while still having considerable life and freshness. It shows the aging ability of Tannat, which dominates the blend with Cabernet Sauvignon and Pinenc. The wine is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2008 Château de la Roque  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This rich, wood-aged wine comes from 40- to 50-year-old vines on an estate at the southern limit of the Madiran appellation. It brings together dense tannins and old-vine concentration. The acidity, black-plum flavors and tannins will keep this wine developing for many years. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peyros 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Madiran)

Description: Oaky scents of vanilla and cream enrich an herbal nose that sports a note of eucalyptus along with black fruit aromas. On the palate, this is flush and smooth, but kind of soft and creamy. Vanilla, coffee, tobacco and wood spice flavors blend with ripe blackberry and black plum notes, while this is generously oaked and thus tastes chocolaty on the finish. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas LAN 2017 A Mano Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Description: This rich, wood-aged wine comes from 40- to 50-year-old vines on an estate at the southern limit of the Madiran appellation. It brings together dense tannins and old-vine concentration. The acidity, black-plum flavors and tannins will keep this wine developing for many years. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peyros 2017 Vieilles Vignes  (Madiran)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Inviting aromas of spiced plum, crushed mint and blue flower are front and center. A blend of Sangiovese, 10% Canaiolo and 5% Mammolo, the brooding palate features dried black cherry, cinnamon and star anise set against a backbone of firm, close-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palazzo Vecchio 2017 Maestro  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Forest floor, new leather, blue flower and camphor aromas are front and center. Firm and focused, the medium-bodied palate offers Marasca cherry, licorice and hints of baking spice set against taut, fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Conventino 2016 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Fragrant and refined, this opens with enticing scents of rose, violet, sandalwood and forest floor. All about finesse, the elegantly structured palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and ground cinnamon set against firm, fine-grained tannins. It's well balanced, with fresh acidity. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selvapiana 2017 Villa Petrognano Red (Pomino)

Description: Made with organically farmed Sangiovese and 5% Merlot, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry, iris and underbrush. The juicy palate offers raspberry, red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Ghizzano 2018 Il Ghizzano Red (Costa Toscana)

Description: Snappy plum and berry aromas include a classic Priorat note of schisty minerality that suggests dried blood. A racy palate settles on juicy brightness, while this blend of Garnacha and Carignan tastes of raspberry, red plum, red currant, cured beef and iron. A steady finish closes this out. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cellers Unió 2018 Tendral Selecció Red (Priorat)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Polished and savory, this medium-bodied red opens with aromas of camphor, wild berry and new leather. On the linear palate, taut tannins accompany juicy Marasca cherry and licorice. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Boscarelli 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Snappy plum and berry aromas include a classic Priorat note of schisty minerality that suggests dried blood. A racy palate settles on juicy brightness, while this blend of Garnacha and Carignan tastes of raspberry, red plum, red currant, cured beef and iron. A steady finish closes this out. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Cellers Unió 2018 Tendral Selecció Red (Priorat)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This polished but full-bodied wine accelerates from light earth, leather and plum aromas to rich, broad flavors of dark chocolate, mushrooms and black cherries. Made with a field blend of traditional California grape varieties, its concentration, depth and complexity are compelling.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Skinner 2018 Native Red (El Dorado)

Description: This is a ripe, polished wine. Wood aging brings a perfumed character to the bold black fruits from old vines. The wine has heft and richness while keeping a succulent character. This estate is situated in the west of the Cahors appellation on the north bank of the Lot river.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Lamartine 2018 Cuvée Particulière  (Cahors)

Description: Plum, berry and prune aromas are on the cusp of smelling baked and cooked but airing allows for expansion and the emergence of iron and schist notes. A full and round palate qualifies as dense, while this Garnacha blend deals cassis, dark plum and chocolaty flavors in front of a composed but chunky finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Potente 2018 Red (Montsant)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This big red has pronounced aromas of forest floor, ground cinnamon, baked plum and violet. The chewy, savory palate has an earthy appeal, offering black cherry, licorice and salted game set against tightly knit, close-grained tannins. Drink now through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bèrne 2016 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Made with 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and Petit Verdot, this has aromas recalling ripe black-skinned berry, menthol and dark spice. The concentrated, velvety palate offers cassis, dried cherry and licorice alongside close-grained, enveloping tannins. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Giusti e Zanza 2018 Dulcamara Red (Costa Toscana)

Description: This is a remarkable wine, both for its age and its completeness. Everything is still there, with the mature fruit still showing life and freshness alongside the secondary flavors and dusty tannins. The single-estate wine, with 91% Tannat in the blend, is, of course, very ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 1999 Château de Sabazan  (Saint-Mont)

Description: The vineyard surrounding this medieval fortress is managed by the Plaimont cooperative. This vintage is a rich blend, with 90% Tannat just releasing its tannins and breathing out its powerful damson fruits. The wine has great acidity along with dense fruitiness and texture, and could age further. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2017 Château de Sabazan  (Saint-Mont)

Description: This blend of Malbec, Syrah and Cabernet Franc opens with raisiny black fruit aromas that reflect the warm conditions of 2012. A full palate with choppy dry tannins deals fully ripe and slightly baked black fruit flavors along with spice notes. A toasty finish with lingering spicy accents concludes this drink-now heavyweight.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Puro Uno 2012 The Mega Artist Series Red (Mendoza)

Description: Initially aggressive and slightly hot aromas of blackberry, cassis and licorice lead to a full palate that's both creamy as well as hard-driving and prodding. Fully ripe blackberry and cassis flavors are a touch jammy in front of a finish that collapses as soon as the wine's acidity peters out. This is 60% Malbec with Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Merlot. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Ameri Single Vineyard Made with Organic Grapes
Name: Domaine Bousquet 2018 Ameri Single Vineyard Made with Organic Grapes Red (Tupungato)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing, earthy aromas of blue flower, perfumed berry and new leather mingle with a hint of truffle on this fragrant red. Full bodied and savory, the juicy palate features mouthfuls of ripe Morello cherry, black plum, licorice and baking spice set against taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Icario 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: The Shiraz and Cab grapes for this organic wine are left to dry on the vine for two weeks, which isn't overly obvious since the wine is fresh fruited, even with some bottle age, and there's a lovely raw, stripped back feel to it. The nose is a fragrant combo of cherry cola, plums, potpourri, dried mint and ground pepper with a medicinal herbal back note. The palate is straightforward—medium to full bodied with gentle, well-integrated tannins and silky fruit—but there's an overall ease and charm about this wine that will make it the first to be drained at the dinner table.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Battle of Bosworth 2014 White Boar Organic Red (McLaren Vale)

Description: This blend of Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, Mediterranean herb and cedar. The firmly structured palate delivers cassis, black currant, licorice and black pepper alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Sette Cieli 2017 Indaco Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of new leather, underbrush and violet mingle with crushed mint on this smooth, full-bodied red. Chewy and enveloping, the juicy palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, baked plum and licorice while tightly knit, fine grained tannins provide support. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina del Giusto 2017 San Claudio II  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of leather, truffle, rose and tilled earth lead the nose on this blend of Sangiovese, 5% Cannaiolo and 5% Mammolo. The savory palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry compote and star anise against taut, close-grained tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it bright. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casale Daviddi 2016  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of caramel, plum, tobacco and cherry. The luscious, plump, juicy fruit flavors have more than enough acidity and tannin structure to hold them up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Grounded Wine Co. 2018 Collusion Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and appropriately tannic wine offers effusive black-fruit aromas, concentrated and dense fruit flavors and nicely integrated accents of smoke and toasted oak. This blend of 70% Alicante Bouschet and 30% Zinfandel is big but joyful, bringing buckets of blackberries and black cherries to coat the palate. Best from 2022–2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Karine 2018 Accomplice Smith Vineyards Red (Calaveras County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of caramel, plum, tobacco and cherry. The luscious, plump, juicy fruit flavors have more than enough acidity and tannin structure to hold them up.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Grounded Wine Co. 2018 Collusion Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Calaveras County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and appropriately tannic wine offers effusive black-fruit aromas, concentrated and dense fruit flavors and nicely integrated accents of smoke and toasted oak. This blend of 70% Alicante Bouschet and 30% Zinfandel is big but joyful, bringing buckets of blackberries and black cherries to coat the palate. Best from 2022–2030.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Karine 2018 Accomplice Smith Vineyards Red (Calaveras County)

Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this vibrant red has aromas of violet, wild berry, camphor and new leather. It's radiant and racy, offering juicy cranberry, orange zest, star anise and crushed mint before closing on a hint of rusty nail. Lithe, polished tannins and vibrant acidity provide the setting. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Selvapiana 2018  Chianti Rufina

Description: A blend of Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, this lithe red has aromas of cassis, blue flower and oak-driven spice. It's medium bodied and smooth, featuring blueberry, blackberry and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Designation: Campo di Sasso Insoglio del Cinghiale
Name: Tenuta di Biserno 2019 Campo di Sasso Insoglio del Cinghiale Red (Toscana)

Description: A blend of Sangiovese, 20% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with enticing aromas of black-skinned berry, leather and cooking spice. The savory, balanced palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2016 Teodoro Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Initially shy, the nose eventually reveals French oak, underbrush, coconut and dried herb. The palate is more expressive, offering mature Morello cherry, orange zest and licorice set against taut, close-grained tannins. A coffee-bean note marks the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa S. Anna 2016 Poldo  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: This estate wine shows the structure as well as richness that comes from the Triguedina vineyard. Tannins are richly balanced by the dark fruits, while licorice gives an edge of bitterness that will soften. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Jean-Luc Baldès 2018 Clos Triguedina  (Cahors)

Description: The blend for this wine is decided each year by two professional tasters. This release brings together Tannat, Pinenc and Cabernet Sauvignon in a generous wood-aged wine that is still young. Firm tannins and rich damson-plum fruits are powerful, demanding time. Drink from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2017 Le Faîte  (Saint-Mont)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Floral and fruity notes compete for attention in this flavorful, full-bodied Rhône-style blend as moderate tannins support rose petal, strawberry and concentrated black cherry on the palate. Best through 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Skinner 2018 Eighteen Sixty-One Red (El Dorado)

Description: With 60% Tannat in the blend with Cabernet Franc, this wine is inevitably rich and structured. Under the still-young tannins and black-fruit flavors, the wine is balanced, with fresh acidity and juicy black-currant flavors. The wine should age further, and will be best drunk from 2023.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Peyros 2017 Tannat-Cabernet  (Madiran)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of forest floor, rose, new leather and crushed botanical herb shape the nose on this classically crafted red. Racy and linear, the vibrant palate features juicy red cherry, cranberry, star anise and white pepper framed in taut tannins. It cries out for food. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Contucci 2016  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Los Angeles County, South Coast, California, US
Description: There's a pleasantly rustic, perhaps old-vine-related character to Grenache-based wines from Los Angeles County, including the dried cherry, dried meat and salt-and-pepper nose on this bottling, which includes 20% Syrah and 10% Merlot. Firm tannins hold up flavors of roasted cherry, vanilla and crème brûlée on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Byron Blatty 2018 Tremor Red (Los Angeles County)

Description: Black cherry, dark plum and animal aromas include hints of dried blood and iron-rich schist. A stout palate is flush and full, with flavors of black cherry, plum, fig and chocolaty oak. A warm finish with baked berry and cocoa flavors is generous but low on complexity. Drink through 2022.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Clos de Tafall 2018 Red (Priorat)

Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, leather and blue flower mingle with grilled herb on this 80% Sangiovese and Merlot blend. Spicy and savory, the linear palate delivers juicy Marasca cherry, star anise and hints of game alongside taut, polished tannins. Tangy acidity keeps it fresh and balanced. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Giusti e Zanza 2019 Belcore Red (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Black-skinned fruit, French oak and violet aromas slowly take shape on this full-bodied red. Densely concentrated, the chewy palate features dried cherry, prune and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poliziano 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: A cloudy burgundy color and aromas of prune, raisin and plum set up a saturated palate that's a bit flat in feel. Rich flavors of prune, raisin, fig and chocolate finish with the softness of a ripe and mature Malbec blend at peak or slightly past its prime. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Algodon 2012 Pima Red (Mendoza)

Description: A blend of 75% Sangiovese, 22% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, espresso and tobacco. The medium-bodied, savory palate offers ripe black currant, vanilla and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Diadema 2018 Red (Toscana)

Description: Five grapes go into this blend, including local varieties Braucol and Prunelard. The resulting wine is well structured, smoothly textured and welcoming. Red fruits and a core of tannins balance each other to give a wine that will be ready from late 2021. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine Rotier 2018 Les Gravels Rouge Red (Gaillac)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Underbrush, baked plum, mint and cocoa aromas slowly take shape in the glass. The brawny palate doles out blackberry jam, cherry tart and licorice alongside close-grained tannins. You'll also notice the warmth of evident alcohol on the close. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ciarliana 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of scorched earth, new leather and roasted nut form the nose along with a whiff of violet. The chewy, savory palate doles out ripe plum, cherry compote and licorice alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Conventino 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Underbrush, camphor, coffee been and cassis aromas follow on to the elegantly structured palate, along with hints of orange zest and star anise. Taut, fine-grained tannins provide lithe support. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2017 Nipozzano Vecchie Viti Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of dark cherry and cedar meet with soy, purple flowers, incense and pepper on the dynamic nose of this aged blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Syrah. A tight texture and bright acidity carries the palate, where crisp yet savory fruit and spice flavors align.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2013 Los Olivos Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Balsamic aromas of camphor mingle with cedar and oak-driven spice on this medium-bodied red. The ripe but elegantly structured palate presents juicy Morello cherry, orange zest, licorice and toasted nut framed in fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio alla Sala 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Scorched earth, truffle and new leather aromas line up in the glass along with whiffs of charcuterie. The big, chewy palate shows steeped prune, licorice and espresso alongside enveloping, fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Ciarliana 2016  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with Sangiovese and 10% Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas recalling underbrush, menthol and whiffs of violet. The linear palate reveals cassis, clove and powdered sage alongside dusty, drying tannins. A coffee-bean note marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lunadoro 2016 Quercione Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Big, booming aromas of black cherry, vanilla, caramel, cappuccino and dark soil show on the nose of this ripe, powerful blend. Black cherry and blackberry jam are rich on the palate but also comforting. This is sure to satisfy those seeking robust flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Highlands 41 2019 Black Granite Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried berries, leather and damp wood aromas show on this blend Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Sangiovese and Syrah. Leather also comes through on the sip, as do incense and redwood flavors as well as licorice and dark, deep red-fruit flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2015 Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Leather, porcini mushroom and balsamic aromas of camphor form the subtle, earthy nose along with a whiff of cedar. The smooth, medium-bodied palate offers dried cherry, tobacco and baking spice alongside drying, fine-grained tannins. It still has fresh acidity but drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palazzo Vecchio 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: This wine is showing age while retaining complexity and richness. Dusty tannins are integrated into the mature texture, with juicy acidity still giving balance. The wine has richness, density from the Tannat's tannins and is ready to enjoy a great moment with rich meat dishes. Drink now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Plaimont 2008 Château Saint-Go  (Saint-Mont)

Description: Raspberry and cranberry aromas take on a floral edge on the nose. The palate echoes and amps up those notes, adding vanilla and tingling spice. The tannins are firmly structured and the acidity is perfectly balanced, adding just enough verve with a long lingering finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Rosemont 2017 Kilravock Signature Red (Virginia)

Description: A blend that includes the rare local Abouriou, this wine is made to drink young and fruity. It's a great success, packed with red-berry flavors and soft tannins freshened by tight acidity. Named after the grandfather of the present generation of the Conti family, the wine is juicy and ready to drink. Organic.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Tour des Gendres 2019 La Vigne d'Albert Red (Bergerac)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Scorched earth, menthol and oak-driven spice aromas shape the nose along with mature black-skinned fruit. The firm, full-bodied palate takes up where the nose left off, recalling ripe black cherry, menthol and star anise. Tightly wound, close-grained tannins grip the close. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antico Colle 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Berry and plum aromas are lightly spiced and show a touch of baby powder. On the palate, this is bright and juicy, with chalky tannins. Spicy berry and plum flavors are aided by a touch of charred oak, while this is toasty, dark and chocolaty tasting on the finish. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Bodegas Olarra 2017 Cerro Añon Crianza  (Rioja)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Subtle gamy and leathery flavors are bolstered by a core of ripe black-cherry flavors in this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine. A blended of Mourvèdre, Zinfandel and Petite Sirah, it has very good concentration and earthy complexity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: William Gunn NV The Boss A Big Red (El Dorado)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this vibrant young red has aromas of wild berry, rose, tilled earth and camphor. Bright and savory, the bright palate features red cherry, pomegranate and star anise framed in easygoing, lithe tannins. It's made to for sheer drinking pleasure so enjoy soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Grignano 2018 Ritratto del Cardinale  (Chianti Rufina)

Description: This is a blend of 30% Malbec, 28% Merlot, 17% Sangiovese, 14% Cabernet Franc and 11% Syrah. The aromas pop in notes of raspberry, blueberry and spice. The palate shows pleasing intensity and sophistication.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Rickshaw 2018 Red (Washington)

Description: Grapey, jammy and packed with enough black-pepper aromas to trigger a sneeze, this medium-bodied wine is fresh and gulpable. Light tannins and subtle acidity keep the texture lively.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Rootdown 2019 Es Okay Red (Mendocino)

Description: This blend of organically grown Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc offers dark-skinned fruit, cedar and mocha aromas. The chewy palate features blackberry jam, clove and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Brancatelli 2016 Valle del Sogno Red (Toscana)

Description: Made from 72% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot, 13% Sangiovese and 1% each of Malbec and Petit Verdot, this is substantial red wine, thick in tannin and smoky oak. Plummy and lush, it finishes in deep, dark chocolate.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Castello di Amorosa 2016 La Castellana Super Tuscan Red (Napa Valley)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Blue-flower, spiced blueberry and camphor aromas waft out of the glass. Taut and linear, the palate offers ripe black cherry, star anise and espresso alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Metinella 2017 Burberosso  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Forest floor, menthol and leather aromas mingle together on this robust red. On the big, brooding palate, close-grained tannins accompany cherry marinated in spirits, prune and licorice. The heat of evident alcohol lingers on the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Montemercurio 2016 Messaggero  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Combining structure and finesse, this has subtle but intriguing aromas of camphor, rose and sunbaked earth. On the taut, juicy palate, fine-grained tannins accompany dried cherry, orange zest and star anise before a coffee-bean finish. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frescobaldi 2017 Nipozzano Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)

Description: Combining structure and finesse, this has subtle but intriguing aromas of camphor, rose and sunbaked earth. On the taut, juicy palate, fine-grained tannins accompany dried cherry, orange zest and star anise before a coffee-bean finish. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frescobaldi 2017 Nipozzano Riserva  (Chianti Rufina)

Description: A blend of 60% Syrah, 20% Sangiovese and Merlot, this light-bodied red has aromas of black-skinned berry, blue flower and cooking spice. Reflecting the nose, the lithe palate doles out juicy Marasca cherry and cooking spice alongside fine-grained tannins that leave a somewhat drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Giusti e Zanza 2019 Nemorino Red (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of red berry, blue flower and spice lead the nose. Savory and linear, the taut palate offers ripe plum, blackberry and star anise before finishing on a note of grilled sage. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Braccesca 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: A blend of organically grown Sangiovese and Alicante, this offers aromas of red-skinned berry, underbrush and white pepper. Made without added sulfites, the juicy, fresh palate features raspberry, cinnamon and clove alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. Enjoy through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Selva 2019 Privo Organic Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of violet, red berry, baking spice and new leather form the nose on this fragrant blend of 90% Sangiovese, Canaiolo Nero and Mammolo. The vibrant palate is already approachable, offering sour cherry, orange zest, uncooked fennel and a note of crushed mint alongside lithe, drying tannins. Bright acidity keeps it light on its feet.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiberini 2016 Podere Le Caggiole  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Made with 60% Sangiovese and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas of ripe black plum, roasted coffee bean and sunbaked soil. The dense palate offers sour cherry, espresso and raw almond alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Certosa di Belriguardo 2016 Chiostro di Venere Red (Toscana)

Description: Made with 80% Sangiovese and 20% Syrah, this offers aromas of black-skinned berry, green tea and tobacco. The savory palate displays black currant, cinnamon and white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Certosa di Belriguardo 2017 Baccano Red (Toscana)

Description: Made with Sangiovese and small percentages of Canaiolo and Colorino, this has aromas recalling red-skinned berry, violet and baking spice. The juicy, easy-drinking palate offers raspberry jam, clove and vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Palazzino 2018 Rosso del Palazzino Red (Toscana)

Description: A blend of organically farmed Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of cedar, black-skinned berry and mocha. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, tobacco, toasted oak and powdered sage alongside assertive, rather drying tannins that grip the finish. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Ghizzano 2017 Nambrot Red (Costa Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Rose, new leather and cedar aromas slowly form the nose. The palate is linear and austere, offering spiced cranberry, star anise, coffee bean and menthol framed in taut, close-grained tannins that leave a lean, drying finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiberini 2013 Vigna Fossatone Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Damp underbrush, leather and blue-flower aromas mingle with a whiff of game. The earthy, no-frills palate offers dried cherry, star anise, sage and the same gamy note as the nose alongside dusty, rather drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fassati 2016 Salaracco Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Cherry aromas ride notes of new leather and cedar planks. Bouncy and crisp acidity brighten cherry and wild raspberry flavors, and tannins are supportive, carrying leather, cedar and tobacco flavors through the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Lovingston 2017 Josie's Knoll Rotunda Red (Monticello)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, leather and a whiff of game form the subtle nose. The rather light-bodied, accessible palate offers prune, licorice and a dollop of vanilla alongside dusty, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Carpineto 2016 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of underbrush, blue flower, leather and stewed cherry form the nose. The medium-bodied, no-frills palate offers dried cherry, cinnamon and star anise alongside dusty, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fanetti - Tenuta S. Agnese 2016 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: This blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot offers aromas of black-skinned berry, mocha and coconut. The forward palate shows blackberry jam, toasted oak and cooking spice alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Diadema 2018 Damare Red (Toscana)

Description: This light-bodied wine has a slim, gripping texture and fresh berry and red-cherry flavors accented by hints of earth and black pepper. It's lively and fresh, great for lunch instead of a rosé.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Donkey & Goat 2019 The Gallivanter Red (California)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with Sangiovese and a dollop of Colorino and Canaiolo, this has aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, leather and blue flower. Medium bodied and straightforward, the palate offers dried cherry, baking spice and a hint of star anise alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bertille 2015 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, baking spice and blue flower come together on this blend of 90% Sangiovese and Colorino. The linear palate stars off with ripe Marasca cherry, orange zest and licorice before grainy tannins abruptly shut it down, with a clenching, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindella 2016 Vallocaia Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with Sangiovese and a dollop of Colorino and Canaiolo, this has aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, leather and blue flower. Medium bodied and straightforward, the palate offers dried cherry, baking spice and a hint of star anise alongside dusty tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bertille 2015 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Forest floor, scorched earth and camphor aromas form the earthy nose while the medium-bodied palate suggests dried cherry, orange rind and a hint of toasted nut. Dusty, drying tannins provide the setting.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fassati 2016 Gersemi  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Soft black fruit aromas are baked and pruny, with a touch of road tar thrown in. Smacking tannins create a grabby palate feel, while slightly stalky plum and blackberry flavors end with tannic rub.                      Michael Schachner
Name: De Haan Altés 2018 Lo Patinet Organically Grown Grapes Red (Montsant)

Description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah, this offers aromas of toasted oak, espresso, and ripe dark-skinned fruit. The extracted palate offers raisin, roasted coffee bean and sage alongside grainy, rather astringent tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Capezzana 2016 Ghiaie della Furba Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of black plum, baked blackberry, nutmeg and flower petals show on the nose of this blend, which comes in a squat bottle. Dry, slightly rough tannins frame dark red-fruit and mace flavors on the palate, which finishes on a Concord grape tone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: KIng Chancho 2017 Bandito's Blood Red (Central Coast)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This full-bodied and moderately tannic wine offers handsome white-pepper and toasted oak aromas followed by tasty blackberry and beef flavors. It shows good concentration and a firm but rounded texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sobon Estate 2018 A Pemium Red (Amador County)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up a little more than three-quarters of this wine, with the rest Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Malbec. The aromas offer notes of cherry, tobacco and mesquite, not seeming entirely settled. The flavors are pulled back, surrounded by bright acidity and smoky flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Gård 2017 The Don Lawrence Estate Wines Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: This blend of Malbec, Shiraz and Merlot is a ripe, raisiny, woodsy bottling showing a fair bit of oak influence along with earthy, peppery herbs and spices, dried florals and eucalyptus. The palate is massive, even with some bottle age. Fruit is dense but fading slightly, and tannins are chewy. Give this several hours in a decanter.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Kellermeister 2015 Ralph's Ensemble Reserve Red (South Australia)

Description: Made with Sangiovese, Ciliegiolo, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this has aromas of sage, toasted oak and cooking spice. The straightforward, concentrated palate shows blackberry jam, mocha and toasted hazelnut alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vignaioli del Morellino di Scansano 2015 Poco per Pochi Red (Toscana)

Description: Attractive mint, menthol and cedar aromas continue in the flavors of this full-bodied, oaky and chocolaty wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 689 Cellars 2018 Killer Drop Red (California)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Linear and fragrant, this offers aromas of wild red berry, sunbaked earth and dark spice. The taut, straightforward palate has Marasca cherry and star anise alongside dusty, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindella 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Cocoa, green pepper and baking spice aromas are followed by broad, seamless flavors of green pepper, cherry and a bit of smoke. Pleasing acidity enlivens it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Stemilt Creek NV Earthen Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Attractive mint, menthol and cedar aromas continue in the flavors of this full-bodied, oaky and chocolaty wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 689 Cellars 2018 Killer Drop Red (California)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Linear and fragrant, this offers aromas of wild red berry, sunbaked earth and dark spice. The taut, straightforward palate has Marasca cherry and star anise alongside dusty, drying tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bindella 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Aromas of black plum, blackberry and leather combine to form the nose. The palate mirrors the nose, adding tobacco and black pepper notes with firm dusty tannins forming the structure.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Revalation 2017 Village Red (Virginia)

Description: Made entirely with Malbec, this opens with aromas of cassis, leather and graphite. The juicy palate offers dried blackberry, clove and vanilla alongside velvety tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa di Terra 2019 Lenaia Red (Toscana)

Description: Jérome Bezios makes this attractive blend of Syrah, Braucol and Duras that is full of fresh fruit, with a touch of pepper and light tannins. Berry flavors and good acidity come together in a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bal Ségur 2018 Tradition Red (Gaillac)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Dark-spice, new leather and sunbaked earth aromas take shape in the glass. Austere and firm, the palate is bit lean in terms of fruit richness, offering unripe cherry, orange rind and star anise set against assertive, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink sooner rather later.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gattavecchi 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Jérome Bezios makes this attractive blend of Syrah, Braucol and Duras that is full of fresh fruit, with a touch of pepper and light tannins. Berry flavors and good acidity come together in a wine that is ready to drink.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bal Ségur 2018 Tradition Red (Gaillac)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This kitchen-sink blend of Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Sangiovese and Syrah shows charred meat, blackberry-jam, licorice and purple-flower aromas on the nose. Deep and dark flavors arise on the palate, where dry tannins frame rugged flavors of charred meat and cedar, leading into a slightly bitter finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Meadowlark 2016 Red (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: Tasty blackberry and blueberry flavors are ripe and jammy in this medium-bodied, lightly tannic wine. It's well packed with fruitiness, smooth in texture and easy to enjoy.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Steele 2017 Persona Non Grata Red (Lake County)

Description: A blend of Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this has pretty aromas of woodland berry, blue flower and baking spice. Fresh and savory, the easygoing palate delivers juicy black cherry, cocoa and star anise framed in supple tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Frescobaldi 2019 Castiglioni  (Chianti)

Description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Sangiovese opens with aromas of dark-skinned fruit, tilled earth and cooking spice. The dense, no-frills palate offers prune, clove and cedar alongside taut tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenute di Mansalto 2018 Castello Rapale Red (Toscana)

Description: A blend of Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this opens with roasted coffee bean, coconut and baking-spice aromas. The straightforward palate offers prune, clove and espresso alongside dusty tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bonacchi 2018 Badesco Red (Toscana)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Blue flower, wild berry and a whiff of spice waft out of the glass. The straightforward, no-frills palate offers ripe cherry and hints of star anise framed in dusty, rather drying tannins. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of wood shop, eucalyptus and a whiff of rose form the subdued nose. Made with Sangiovese, 10% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, this red has a palate that offers more oak-driven spice, vanilla and candied notes alongside astringent, grainy tannins that clench the finish. It's already evolved and doesn't have the fruit richness to stand up to the oak-driven sensations.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte alla Flora 2015 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this bright red has aromas of forest berry, violet and a whiff of moist earth. The somewhat lean palate offers sour cherry, orange rind and hints of dark spice alongside taut, drying tannins. Zesty acidity keeps it lively.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Grignano 2018  Chianti Rufina

Description: Cassis and black cherry meld with leather on the nose. The palate is loaded with plum and cranberry with bright acidity. Tannins are gentle leading into a spicy finish with rich oak tones.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Pearmund NV Black Ops Red (Virginia)

Description: Fruit-forward aromas of plum, huckleberry and dried herbs lead to tart, center-focused green pepper and cherry flavors with some tart acidity behind them. There are good things happening, but it comes off as a bit green.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Huston 2019 Chicken Dinner Red (Idaho)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Plum, medicine and asphalt aromas are followed by plump, fleshy blue fruit, green herb and smoke flavors that paint around the edges. The medicinal notes provide some distraction.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Mercer Bros. 2018 Edge of Heaven Red (Horse Heaven Hills)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of rose, graphite and botanical herb lift out of the glass along with a whiff of new leather. The medium-bodied, no-frills palate offers dried cherry, ground clove and a hint of dried mint alongside dusty, somewhat drying tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2017 Poggio Stella  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Cranberry and apple peel form the nose. The palate offers tart acidity, red apple and red plum that are juicy upfront but lead to slightly unruly tannins and rubber on the finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Veramar 2018 JB Terracotta Red (Virginia)

Description: Made with Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas recalling damp soil, leather and clove. The simple palate offers red plum, vanilla and caramel alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bonacchi 2018 Borghetto Red (Toscana)

Description: Produced from old vines, this wine suffers from too much wood aging. While some of that toasty character will go, it masks the blend of Syrah and Braucol that clamors to get out. Drink from 2022.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château Bal Ségur 2017 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes Red (Gaillac)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has aromas recalling underbrush, camphor and a whiff of rose. The lean, austere palate opens with dried cherry and espresso before grainy tannins give it an abrupt, extremely astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vecchia Cantina di Montepulciano 2017 Cantina del Redi  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)

Description: Aromas of raisin and prune are dense and stewy, while this blend of Monastrell and Syrah feels thick and sappy, with raisiny desiccation. Prune, raisin, fig and chocolate flavors fail to shed an overripe character on a baked and heavy finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Crápula 2019 Cr Gold 5 Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of smoke and Vicks VapoRub lead to flavors that are plump around the edges and lighter in the middle.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Next 2017 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Côtes de Gascogne, Southwest France, France
Description: This stalky, young blend of Merlot and Tannat is full of red fruits, with bright acidity and a texture that emphasizes freshness. Drink the wine now.                      Roger Voss
Name: Domaine la Taste 2019 Harmonie de la Taste Red (Côtes de Gascogne)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has subtle aromas suggesting rose, weedy underbrush, eucalyptus oil and scorched earth. The light-bodied, lean palate recalls prune and roasted coffee bean alongside dusty, fleeting tannins that leave and abrupt, mouthdrying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Duca di Cardino 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: A touch of sweetness smooths out this nicely fruity and lightly spicy wine. It's soft in texture, full bodied and mouthfilling, offering blackberry and hints of black pepper.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bota Box NV RedVolution Red (California)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting weedy underbrush, used leather and French oak lead the subdued nose. The lean, austere palate suggests unripe berry, roasted coffee bean and green notes of powdered sage, while raspy tannins leave an abrupt, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Svetoni 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Black cherry aromas are reminiscent of cough syrup. The palate delivers black plum tied to tangy acidity, with notes of cedar and leather along with dusty tannin.                      Fiona Adams
Name: James River 2015 Monitor VS. CSS Virginia Red (Virginia)

Appellation: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of burned rubber and scorched earth carry over to the lean, diluted palate along with the barest hint of prune. It also has green notes of powdered sage as well as astringent, fleeting tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Duca di Saragnano 2017  Vino Nobile di Montepulciano

Description: Lifted berry and floral cherry and black plum aromas are supported by mineral notes and lightly toasted oak. On the palate, an explosion of ripe, pulpy berry fruit and snappy acidity settles with ease and elegance, while this Cabernet Sauvignon from a warm and dry year offers blackberry, cassis and chocolaty oak flavors. There's plenty of depth to a smooth and balanced finish. This is one of those awesome Mas La Plana wines to hold for many years; best from 2025–2045.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Torres 2015 Mas la Plana Red (Penedès)

Description: Smoke, a hint of camphor, plum and supple vanilla richness are smooth on the aromatic nose. The palate still has grip but is exquisitely pure, presenting plum and blueberry freshness and allowing that vanilla note to cede to cedar and tobacco. This is elegant, juicy, poised and only just opening up. Drink by 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2017 Comondor Red (Burgenland)

Description: Ripe, smooth berry and currant aromas come with a note of graphite on a convincing nose that promises great things to come. The palate on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cab Franc is smooth and pure, with modest but notable acidic kick. Blackberry, cassis and black pepper flavors are on the money, while this registers as composed, balanced and holding more in store; drink from 2024–2045.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Torres 2016 Reserva Real Red (Penedès)

Description: Both fresh and baked blueberry notes are immediate on the aromatic nose. They are joined by warm cinnamon spice and a touch of undergrowth. The palate is pervaded by freshness that highlights the silky nature of the tannins, the slight grip and the beautiful concentration. Yes, this has power, but also real elegance. Lovely now, it is certain to evolve. Drink by 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gernot and Heike Heinrich 2017 Salzberg Red (Burgenland)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Underbrush, ripe black-skinned fruit, purple flower and baking spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this velvety, savory red. Smooth and concentrated, it's also weightless, doling out succulent black cherry, baked plum, licorice and tobacco set against enveloping, polished tannins. Drink through 2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Masi 2012 Campolongo di Torbe  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: White and black pepper, cinnamon, ripe plum and aromatic blueberry unite into a most appetizing aroma. The supple palate also holds that wonderful pepperiness, enlivening the beautifully aromatic plum and berry notions with vividness. There is a core of fine freshness that makes the fine, smooth tannins appear even sleeker.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Nittnaus Anita und Hans 2017 Pannobile Red (Burgenland)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Ripe plum, blue flower and spice aromas lift out of the glass in this full-bodied red. The smooth, concentrated palate boasts a weightless elegance, delivering blackberry compote, ripe Morello cherry, licorice and baking spice framed in enveloping, velvety tannins. Drink 2022–2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Allegrini 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: Sweet red icewines are not your everyday discovery unless you happen to live where they are made. But this rare wine is a spectacular match for dense chocolate desserts. Black cherry, sweet spice, candied orange peel and apricot jam flavors are here in force. A blend of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this little gem is packaged in 200ml bottles, with flavors so rich that one bottle will serve four as dessert.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Stratus 2018 Icewine Red (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Description: Notions of smoke, Damson, blueberry, cinnamon and plum all come together on the aromatic, evolving nose. Both sleekness and freshness strike immediately on the palate. There is a juiciness among that dark-fruited density that shows the sinuous structure of the wine. This is bold but poised, with resolving, very fine tannins. The finish holds a wonderful echo of pepperiness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gernot and Heike Heinrich 2017 Gabarinza Red (Burgenland)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This well-balanced 72% Zinfandel blend is a classic. Concentrated in flavor and firm in structure, it is also silky in texture and so easy to sip and swallow. The nose is packed with hints of charcoal, black fruits and black pepper, while the palate boasts plump blackberry and tangy raspberry shaded by salt and pepper notes. Best from 2024.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2018 Lytton Springs Red (Dry Creek Valley)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Crushed violet, baked plum, underbrush and new leather aromas mingle together in the glass. Velvety and densely concentrated, the bold, delicious palate doles out mouthfuls of raspberry jam, steeped prune and baking spice before a tobacco finish. Despite its big, bold structure, it boasts refined tannins that provide seamless support and polish. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tedeschi 2015 La Fabriseria Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe red plum, new leather, blue flower and pipe tobacco mingle together in this bold red. The full-bodied palate features steeped prune, raisin, licorice and sandalwood alongside tightly woven, velvety tannins. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte del Frà 2016 Tenuta Lena di Mezzo  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Schisty aromas of iron and steel are hard to miss on a nose with earthy but fully ripe berry scents. This textbook Priorat blends minerally grip with creamy weight and pulpy ripe flavors of black cherry and black plum, while the finish is slightly sweet and on the easy side, indicating an open drinking window of now through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Torres 2016 Perpetual Red (Priorat)

Description: A rather subtle nose of smoke, blueberry and gentle vanilla characterises this wine. The palate then presents a vanilla-scented wealth of blueberries that reverberate with a gorgeous freshness, a peppery verve and fine, silky tannins. Yes, this is bold but it is also elegant.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Artner 2017 Ried Aubühl Red (Carnuntum)

Description: Savory blackberry and cassis aromas are accented by herbal notes, all fitting for Chile and the Maipo Valley. A deep palate with smooth tannins is freshened by lively acidity, while this Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend tastes of ripe berry, black plum, mixed spices and green herbs. A steady finish holds its line. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Carmen 2018 Delanz Red (Maipo Valley)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This full-bodied, velvety red offers balsamic aromas of camphor, leather, cedar and star anise that mingle with ripe black-skinned fruit. The concentrated, elegantly structured palate features raisin, tobacco and licorice while fine-grained tannins lend finesse. It closes on a coffee bean note. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cesari 2013 Il Bosco  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Smoke, tar, plum and chocolate blend into a united, fruity richness on the nose. The palate is dense and compact, wonderfully fresh and endowed with really supple, fine and smooth tannins that are imbued with smoky, tarry juiciness. This is one elegant number, full of poise and promise. Drink 2022–2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Markowitsch 2018 Ried Rosenberg Red (Carnuntum)

Description: Black-skinned fruit, new leather, tilled earthy and blue flower aromas mingle with camphor on this fragrant, enticing red. Fresh and savory, the elegant, full-bodied palate doles out ripe black plum, juicy Morello cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside polished tannins that give it a velvety texture. Fresh acidity lends brightness and balance. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello dei Rampolla 2018  Chianti Classico

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Underbrush, new leather, spice and steeped prune aromas shape the nose along with whiffs of violet. Its firm and full-bodied palate offers raisin, licorice and espresso alongside tightly knit, close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cesari 2010 Bosan Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Chocolate and plum aromas on the nose are still shy. The palate comes in with density and richness, with ripe but firm tannins that dry the mouth. Dark fruit is smoothed and enriched with vanilla and there is a velvety swish already. Fine freshness keeps everything taut. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Markowitsch 2017 M1 Red (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this full-bodied, plush red has inviting aromas of baked plum, new leather, camphor and violet. Smooth and enveloping, the delicious palate doles out mouthfuls of fruit cake, baking spice, fleshy blackberry and licorice. Velvety tannins provide softness while fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Speri 2016 Sant'Urbano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This extremely affordable blend of 80% Syrah and 20% Petit Verdot always impresses. Expertly captured aromas of berry juice, pepper and thyme are savory yet soft on the nose. The palate is tense in structure but ripe in fleshy dark-red-fruit flavors, all elevated by cracked pepper and lavender touches.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Stolpman 2019 Para Maria de Los Tecolotes Red (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Aromas of red berry, slate, Mediterranean scrub and rhubarb form the delicate, enticing nose. Elegantly structured, the taut, radiant palate features red cherry, crushed strawberry, graphite and iron notes alongside extremely refined tannins. Bright acidity keeps it balanced. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Davide Fregonese 2016 Riserva Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Red berry, rose and Mediterranean scrub aromas form the lovely fragrance. Lithe and elegant, the savory palate features ripe red cherry, raspberry, star anise and flinty mineral alongside polished, supple tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Giovanni Rosso 2017 Rosso  (Etna)

Description: Charred meat, black-pepper, tar and roasted black-plum and berry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 68% Cabernet Franc, 20% Syrah and 12% Merlot. The palate combines smoked beef with blueberry and boysenberry sauce as well as black-pepper spice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Al Lago 2017 Crescendo Red (California)

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Fragrant and loaded with finesse, this lovely red has enticing aromas of wild berry, blue flower and Mediterranean brush. The elegant, savory palate delivers juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, star anise and iron notes framed in smooth, polished tannins. Fresh acidity keeps it well balanced. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Calì 2014 Forfice  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico)

Description: Smoky plum, blueberry and black cherry unite into dark-fruited richness on the nose. The palate is concentrated and despite the ripe fruit, there is a firm tannic structure and a certain muscular boldness. Slight cinnamon spice shimmers around the smokiness, melding into hints of tar. This is big and bold but also smooth and fresh. Drink by 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2018 Excellent Reserve Red (Niederösterreich)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A grippy texture supports ample and ripe black-fruit flavors in this full-bodied, moderately tannic blend of Syrah, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon. Nuances of cedar and cinnamon add welcome complexity on the palate as the texture softens and encourages blackberry notes to emerge on the finish. For a nonvintage wine it's extraordinary.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sierra Vista NV Elevation 2800 Red (El Dorado)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Violet, mature black-skinned fruit and new leather are some of the aromas you get on this big, bold red. Powerfully structured, the full-bodied palate features steeped prune, fruitcake and licorice framed in tightly knit, velvety tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zenato 2015 Sergio Zenato Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: A round but wild smelling nose features aromas of tobacco, green herbs, animal hide and berry. This Cabernet blend pokes and prods with edgy acidity, but overall the palate is rock solid. Flavors of herbs and berries are supported by chocolaty oak prior to a finish with a distinct Chilean mint character. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casas del Toqui 2018 Codigo Red (Cachapoal Valley)

Description: Savory blackberry and plum aromas come with earthy notes, a hint of herbal green and charred oak. The palate on this Cabernet Sauvignon blend is plump and a touch jammy, with generous ripeness and weight. Blackberry, plum, peppery spice and chocolaty oak flavors finish steady, with a lasting bolt of acidity. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casas del Toqui 2018 Filius Court Rollan Alto Totihue Red (Cachapoal Valley)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: New leather, truffle, menthol and baked plum aromas slowly emerge on this inviting, full-bodied red. Smooth and savory, the velvety palate doles out fleshy black cherry, fig, tobacco and licorice alongside polished, enveloping tannins. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cesari 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas of violet, tobacco and black-skinned berry emerge from the glass. The savory, full-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicolis 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Tobacco, prune and blue flower aromas mingle with a whiff of spice and sunbaked earth. Full-bodied and enveloping, the palate features raisin, licorice and baking spice before finishing on a note of bitter almond. Supple tannins offer polished support. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Masi 2012 Mazzano  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Underbrush, ripe plum, camphor and spice are just some of the aromas you'll find in this full-bodied red. Juicy and savory, the bold palate offers blackberry jam, prune, licorice and tobacco alongside an earthy hint of truffle. Velvety tannins provide seamless support. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Masi 2015 Costasera  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Blue flower, steeped prune, sandalwood and pipe tobacco aromas mingle together in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the supple, full-bodied palate features raisin, blackberry jam, vanilla and cocoa set against enveloping, velvety tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte del Frà 2015 Scarnocchio Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas of violet, tobacco and black-skinned berry emerge from the glass. The savory, full-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicolis 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: Quite light in the glass, this blend of 50% Carignan, 48% Grenache and 2% Mourvèdre starts with earthy aromas of soil, gamy charcuterie and freshly crushed scents of cran-raspberry and strawberry. There's a rugged, meaty tone to the sip, which is offset by bright and snappy pomegranate flashes, leading into pepper and herbs toward the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Birichino 2018 Scylla Red (California)

Description: Made with Sangiovese and small amounts of Canaiolo and Malvasia Nera, this fragrant red has alluring aromas of herbs, truffle, pine forest and blue flowers. The taut, savory palate features juicy Morello cherry, cinnamon and white pepper set against firm, fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it vibrant. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa Emma 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Inviting aromas of baked plum, fragrant blue flowers, camphor and cooking spices shape the nose. The smooth, savory palate features cassis, blackberry jam, star anise and nutmeg framed in polished, enveloping tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pasqua 2015 Famiglia Pasqua  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Smooth oak and floral aromas back red-berry fruit scents on a convincing nose. A dry palate with pulling tannins holds woody flavors of toast, baking spice, red plum and currant. There's power and length to the finish, which also provides vanilla and coffee notes. The 2014 vintage wasn't a good one in Rioja but this gran reserva is showing well. Drink through 2030.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2014 Cédula Real Gran Reserva  (Rioja)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of cassis, French oak and coconut mingle with fragrant purple flowers on this bold red. Densely concentrated, the palate also shows finesse, delivering fruitcake, raisin, vanilla and nutmeg set against tightly woven, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2033.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Allegrini 2013 Fieramonte Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of 69% Cabernet Sauvignon, 27% Petite Sirah, 2% Syrah and 2% Malbec offers aromas of black-cherry pie, toasty brioche and fresh mint on the nose. That minty element carries to the palate, where more black cherry and fudge flavors are wrapped in ample acidity and chalky tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: J. Lohr 2018 Pure Paso Proprietary Red (Paso Robles)

Description: This complex, layered and inviting wine combines power with good balance as it spreads deep, dark-fruit, black-pepper, and light woodsmoke across the palate. It's firmly tannic but so flavorful that the dark berries and black olives balance out the tannins and linger on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2018 Nero Red (Lodi)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, nutmeg and tobacco shape the inviting nose. The savory, balanced palate delivers blackberry jam, mocha, tobacco and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2031.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: SalvaTerra 2015 Campocroce  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: This powerfully structured red opens with aromas of French oak, cedar, leather and cassis. The firm, full-bodied palate delivers steeped prune, coconut, grilled herbs and licorice alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins. It closes on a roasted coffee bean note. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pasqua 2012 Mai Dire Mai  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: A smoky, meaty quality separates this concentrated and moderately tannic wine from the pack while gorgeous blackberry and black-cherry flavors coat the palate and linger on the finish. This Zin-based blend adds Carignan, Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet. It shows soft tannins for a velvety texture, and a warm blend of fruit and oak expressions.                      Jim Gordon
