Name: Ridge 2018 Geyserville Red (Alexander Valley)

Description: A smoky, meaty quality separates this concentrated and moderately tannic wine from the pack while gorgeous blackberry and black-cherry flavors coat the palate and linger on the finish. This Zin-based blend adds Carignan, Petite Sirah and Alicante Bouschet. It shows soft tannins for a velvety texture, and a warm blend of fruit and oak expressions.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2018 Geyserville Red (Alexander Valley)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is an intriguing blend of 32% Touriga Nacional, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Syrah, 13% Grenache, and 12% Tinta Cão, along with bits of Souzão and Cinsault. Aromas of cocoa, black raspberry, satsuma, plum and herb flavors are followed by beautifully balanced, restrained but still plentiful fruit flavors. It brings a lot of flat out enjoyment.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: The Walls 2018 Stanley Groovy Red (Red Mountain)

Description: This powerfully structured red opens with aromas of French oak, cedar, leather and cassis. The firm, full-bodied palate delivers steeped prune, coconut, grilled herbs and licorice alongside assertive, fine-grained tannins. It closes on a roasted coffee bean note. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pasqua 2012 Mai Dire Mai  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Aged for a year in large barrels, this ripe, softly textured wine is a Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon blend. It has richness, succulent black fruits and a warm structure that gives the wine generosity. The aftertaste is lifted by acidity. Drink from late 2021.                      Roger Voss
Name: Château la Martinette 2018 Red (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of stewed prune, underbrush, violet and sandalwood form the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the dense palate features raisin, fig and licorice alongside velvety tannins. It's already approachable but will also offer years of enjoyment. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Masi 2013 Costasera Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of Mediterranean brush, blue flower and leather waft out of the glass along with a whiff of eucalyptus. Elegant and savory, the luminous palate delivers juicy red cherry, strawberry compote, ground clove and a hint of coffee bean before wrapping up on an iron note. Supple tannins give polished support. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Calì 2017 Manene  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico)

Description: Hints of smoke and tar are all that is revealed on this still closed nose. On the palate, this relaxes into a smooth gloss of blackberry, plum and black cherry. There is something smooth and flowing here, accentuated by freshness and a touch of cocoa. The tannins are fine and ripe and linger smokily on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: R&A Pfaffl 2018 Privat Für Meine Julia Red (Niederösterreich)

Description: Made with 90% Corvina Veronese and 10% Oseleta, this full-bodied red boasts aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, tobacco, French oak and new leather. Elegantly structured, the palate features blackberry, Morello cherry, vanilla and a hint of star anise framed in taut, refined tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Allegrini 2017 La Grola Red (Veronese)

Description: Violet, forest floor, oak-driven spice and a whiff of camphor shape the nose. Extremely elegant, the focused palate delivers juicy plum, vanilla and star anise set against polished tannins and tangy acidity. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casa al Vento 2016 V'Incanto Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of graphite, botanical herbs and blue flowers are front and center. On the medium-bodied palate, bright acidity and taut, refined tannins support juicy red cherry, licorice and tobacco. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Meleto 2016 Vigna Poggiarso  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, dark-skinned fruit and new leather. The savory, balanced palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and black pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Dama 2016 La Dama  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, mocha and new leather lead the nose. The savory palate offers Marasca cherry, clove and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattori 2016 Col de la Bastià  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: Red Hills, Lake County, California, US
Description: Robust and rich, this full-bodied wine offers deep black-fruit flavors that seem to melt into dark chocolate wrapped in soft tannins. Opulent dried blackberry, blueberry and black cherry blend with light woodsmoke, clove and cinnamon that expand on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sol Rouge 2017 The Keep Red (Red Hills)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This single-vineyard bottling opens with multifaceted aromas of new leather, forest floor, fragrant purple flowers and spice. The bold, densely concentrated palate doles out baked plum, stewed prune, nutmeg and licorice framed in tightly knit, velvety tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol on the close, but the fleshy fruit flavors don't let it dominate. Drink 2022–2030.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tedeschi 2015 Capitel Monte Olmi Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Aromas of crushed mint, rosemary, blue flowers and hazelnut are front and center. On the brawny palate, tightly knit, velvety tannins accompany prune, nutmeg and espresso. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tedeschi 2016 Marne 180  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, mocha and new leather lead the nose. The savory palate offers Marasca cherry, clove and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattori 2016 Col de la Bastià  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Blending near-equal parts Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with a handful of Petit Verdot, this red is softly layered, rich and nicely balanced. Fragrant aromas of freshly picked blackberries echo on the palate alongside black currant, mocha and a finishing touch of toasted oak.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Gamble Family Vineyards 2017 Paramount Red (Napa Valley)

Description: Inviting aromas of black-skinned berry, warm spice and tobacco emerge from the glass. The savory, balanced palate delivers blackberry jam, ripe raspberry and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Enjoy through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sartori 2015 Estate Collection  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of baked plum, blue flowers, new leather and oak-driven spice are front and center. On the enveloping palate, fine-grained tannins and the warmth of evident alcohol accompany steeped prune, licorice, dried cherry and espresso.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Secondo Marco 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: A dark ruby color and aromas of road tar, smoke and black fruits open this Carignan that contains small amounts of Garnacha and Cinsault. The palate is flush, round and grounded by firm tannins. Baked plum and cassis flavors show a touch of prune, while this is full and grabby on a finish with a shot of lasting acidity. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Undurraga 2016 Vigno Old Vines Dry-Farmed Red (Maule Valley)

Appellation: Contra Costa County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Firmly structured and nicely spicy, this full-bodied wine (made from Carignan, Mataro and Zinfandel vines from a property first planted in 1888) is packed with raspberry, blackberry and black-pepper flavors. Its polished texture of fine-grained tannins balance a warm, dried fruit finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2018 Evangelho Red (Contra Costa County)

Description: Spicy blackberry and cassis aromas come with accents of hot rocks and herbals on the nose. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Carmenère is lush and layered, with a beam of acidity boosting brightness and balance. Cassis and blackberry flavors are naturally spicy and aided by oaky notes of mocha and chocolate. Drink through 2023.                      Michael Schachner
Designation: Lone Rider Premium Selection Estate Bottled
Name: Sierra Batuco 2016 Lone Rider Premium Selection Estate Bottled Red (Maule Valley)

Description: This robust blend of 37% Tannat, 33% Petit Verdot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon starts off with sultry aromas of black cherry, rose, vanilla and cocoa. Black currant and black cherry flavors combine with leather, cigar box and velvety tannins for an alluring experience on the palate. Tannins hug the mouth on the finish, with a dusting of pepper and oak.                      Fiona Adams
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Adagio Red (Virginia)

Description: Refined aromas of blue flowers, ripe dark-skinned berry and spice shape the nose. It's elegantly structured, featuring red cherry, orange zest and licorice flavors set against taut, fine-grained tannins. Bright acidity keeps it balanced and fresh. Drink 2022–2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valiano 2016 Poggio Teo  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Initially closed, the nose eventually reveals new leather, forest floor, blue flowers and dried aromatic herbs. The structured palate delivers ripe Marasca cherry, tobacco and baking spice set against tightly wound, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria Petriolo 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Cedar, dark-skinned fruit and vanilla aromas form the nose on this hearty red. The chewy palate offers baked plum, coconut and star anise alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicolis 2011 Ambrosan  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of this wine are engaging in notes of cherry cordial, dark chocolate shavings, raspberry and barrel spice. Rich coffee and cherry flavors follow on the full-bodied palate while a café au lait note lingers on the lengthy finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Nine Hats 2018 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Jammy aromas of blackberry and cassis are supported by cheesy oak and molasses. A viscous palate is almost syrupy in consistency, while this tastes of superripe blackberry, sun-baked black currant and chocolaty oak. A smooth but thick finish is rich in flavor but tips the scale towards heavy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Perinet 2016 Red (Priorat)

Description: Black-skinned fruit, violet and underbrush aromas lead the way. The bold palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and fig alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Acinum 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: Aromas of scorched soil, coconut, star anise and baked plum form the nose. Showing the heat of the vintage, the smooth, ripe palate is already soft and accessible, offering fleshy black cherry, tobacco and roasted coffee bean alongside polished tannins. Drink or hold through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Monsanto 2015 Vigneto Il Poggio Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Cedar, dark-skinned fruit and vanilla aromas form the nose on this hearty red. The chewy palate offers baked plum, coconut and star anise alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nicolis 2011 Ambrosan  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas of this wine are engaging in notes of cherry cordial, dark chocolate shavings, raspberry and barrel spice. Rich coffee and cherry flavors follow on the full-bodied palate while a café au lait note lingers on the lengthy finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Nine Hats 2018 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Jammy aromas of blackberry and cassis are supported by cheesy oak and molasses. A viscous palate is almost syrupy in consistency, while this tastes of superripe blackberry, sun-baked black currant and chocolaty oak. A smooth but thick finish is rich in flavor but tips the scale towards heavy.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Perinet 2016 Red (Priorat)

Description: Tones of dark chocolate and rich black fruit give an intriguing personality to this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine. Cocoa notes melt on the palate as the flavors expand through a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2018 Old Soul Red (Mendocino)

Description: Aromas of violet, lavender, cardamom and tire rubber blend with blueberry and blackberry. Savory black plum and oak flavors are plodding, while this is saturated on a finish that churns with dry tannins and a forceful wood character. Drink through 2028.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Finca Allende 2014 Aurus  (Rioja)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned fruit, sandalwood and tobacco emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and licorice alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corteforte 2012 Vigneti di Osan  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Tones of dark chocolate and rich black fruit give an intriguing personality to this full-bodied, moderately tannic wine. Cocoa notes melt on the palate as the flavors expand through a lingering finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2018 Old Soul Red (Mendocino)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of mature dark-skinned fruit, sandalwood and tobacco emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and licorice alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corteforte 2012 Vigneti di Osan  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of black-skinned berry, warm spice and scorched earth shape the nose. On the concentrated palate, firm tannins accompany flavors of blackberry jam, tobacco and ground clove. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Armani 2015 Cuslanus Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This plush blend of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon offers dense tones of plum and blackberry accented by mentholated tobacco, moss and soy. The medium-bodied palate is etched in juicy black fruit flavors framed by suave tannins and bright acidity. A gentle herbal tone brings lift to an otherwise brooding wine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2014 Musée Red (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's a spicy, peppery edge to the nose of this wine, giving focus to the tight core of bramble berries and currants that rides beneath. A blend of Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, the palate is lithe yet energetic in feel, driven by equal measures of tart mixed berries, dried herbs and crushed black pepper. Crushed velvet tannins lend a seductive vibe, making this ready to be enjoyed in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2015 Taste Red (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of French oak, blue flowers, coconut and cassis form the nose on this full-bodied red. The enveloping palate doles out raisin, fruitcake, vanilla and dark chocolate alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bolla 2015 Le Origini Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Appealing aromas of black-skinned berries, pipe tobacco and cocoa emerge from the glass. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Buglioni 2016 Il Lussurioso  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This wine is a blend of 38% Syrah, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Merlot. The aromas suggest notes of anise, dark cherry, plum and spice. Bountiful dark-fruit flavors follow, with the tannins giving a gentle squeeze. It gives the bounty of fruit and acid that 2018 offers.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Goose Ridge 2018 Vireo Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Black-skinned berries, violet, tobacco and a whiff of graphite lead the nose on this hearty red. The structured palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and vanilla alongside fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zonin 2017  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: Aromas of cassis and raisin are backed by hints of forest floor, mulch and tree bark. This blend of 80% Carmenère and 20% Malbec from a rainy year is full bodied but less than precise. Earthy berry flavors expand with airing. Drink now.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Casa Donoso 2016 Sucesor Red Limited Release Red (Maule Valley)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, underbrush and tobacco. The savory, balanced palate shows black cherry jam, star anise and clove alongside firm acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink 2022–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca di Castagnoli 2016 Poggio a' Frati Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of tomato leaf, grilled beef, green herbs and spiced berry fruits are classic Chilean. On the palate, this blend feels condensed and rich. Savory blackberry and plum flavors are fully herbal, while it is smooth on the finish. Drink through 2026.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Carolina 2018 Edition Assemblage Red (Chile)

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This blend of Merlot, Petite Sirah, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon is a satisfying sipper for a fair price. Aromas of black cherry, dark cocoa, leather and charred beef lead into a creamy palate of espresso and roasted meat, bolstered by a cranberry sauce flavor and chalky tannins.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Smith & Hook 2017 Proprietary Red (Central Coast)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of violet, cooking spices and underbrush. The firm, brawny palate shows dried black cherry, star anise and black pepper alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta Santa Maria 2013 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Blue flower, forest berry, new leather and underbrush aromas form the alluring nose. Smooth and juicy, the savory palate doles out ripe black cherry, plum, licorice and a hint of espresso alongside supple tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2017 Brolio-Bettino  (Chianti Classico)

Description: A blend of three vintages (2015, 2016, 2017) of amphora-aged Montepulciano d'Abruzzo, this red offers a raspy nose of blackberry and plum accented by base nose of gravel and herbs. It's plush, rounded and full on the palate, offering a mix of dried and fresh berry flavors propped up by bright acidity. A firm framing of tannins lends support, with taut fruit lingering on the finish. Enjoy in the near term.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Francesco Cirelli NV Amphora 15+16+17 Organic Red (Italy)

Description: Dense aromas of cigar box, cocoa nib, crushed black pepper and cinnamon carry the spice-driven nose of this blend of Magliocco, Gaglioppo, Nerello Cappuccio and Greco Nero. It's rich and enveloping on the palate, with a core of thick black plum framed by rigid tannins and integrated acidity. There's power and weight to it all, yet it's properly lifted, yielding a brooding yet balanced red blend.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Odoardi 2014 GB Red (Calabria)

Description: This opens with aromas recalling candied cherry, cooking spices and charred earth. The forward palate features blackberry jam, vanilla and fig alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Montresor 2015 Capitel de la Crosara  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: Bold and packed with black-fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine supports ripe berries with moderate tannins and subtle oak spices of cedar and graphite. It's a well-rounded, mouthfilling wine that will please a lot of palates.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Jigar 2015 Raja Cuvée Red (North Coast)

Appellation: Wahluke Slope, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This is a unique blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Roussanne, released early and recommended drinking with a slight chill. The aromas intrigue, with notes of rhubarb, cherry and cinnamon. The flavors are soft and plump. It delights.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Concentric Wine Project 2019 60/40 Red (Wahluke Slope)

Description: Dark, smoky and husky, this full-bodied wine layers toasted oak, black pepper and meaty accents on a sturdy core of blackberry and black cherry. Moderate tannins give those powerful flavors good support.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Banshee 2018 Red (California)

Description: Toasted oak, mocha and ripe dark-skinned fruit aromas lead the nose. The chewy, savory palate offers baked plum, vanilla and espresso alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castellani Michele & Figli 2016 Cinque Stelle  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Forest berries, blue flowers and crushed mint are behind the pretty nose. Bright and savory, the linear palate offers crushed cherry, orange peel and star anise alongside taut, fine-grained tannins. Best through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castellare 2017 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, French oak, crushed mint and blue flower aromas come to the forefront. Reflecting the nose, the palate shows its oak influence, offering coconut, espresso and vanilla alongside pomegranate and sour cherry. Fine-grained tannins provide the framework. Drink 2022–2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Vicchiomaggio 2016 Le Bolle Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas recalling French oak, camphor and dark spice form the subtle nose. Taut and linear, the palate features dried cherry, star anise and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cecchi 2016 Valore di Famiglia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Crushed berry, botanical herb and baking spice aromas mingle with a whiff of sunbaked earth. The medium-bodied, savory palate offers ripe Marasca cherry, licorice and coffee bean alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca delle Macìe 2017 Famiglia Zingarelli Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Look for the tiny e.9 on the label to make certain you have this most recent release, as all are different blends. This latest includes Syrah, Sangiovese, Montepulciano and 5% Evolution White. Soft and fruity, it's an easy-drinking, gulpable everyday red, with plum and berry fruit. Tart, lemony acidity carries it along, showcasing all the clean fruit.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser NV Evolution Big Time Red (America)

Description: This has aromas of underbrush, truffle, blue flowers and French oak. Reflecting the nose, the tightly wound, full-bodied palate features coconut, vanilla and licorice that accent a black cherry core. Close-grained tannins provide the tight framework and leave an assertive, drying close. Drink 2023–2029.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Arceno 2017 Strada del Sasso Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas recalling candied cherry, cooking spices and charred earth. The forward palate features blackberry jam, vanilla and fig alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Montresor 2015 Capitel de la Crosara  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this has earthy aromas of blue flowers, truffle and new leather with a hint of game. The smooth, juicy palate features ripe Morello cherry, orange zest, star anise and a hint of mint alongside dusty tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Principe Corsini - Villa Le Corti 2016 Le Corti  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This bold and bright old-vine field blend combines ripe black fruit with tart red-fruit flavors for a vibrant expression that's full bodied but stays lively through the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Saracina 2018 Winter's Edge Red (Mendocino)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This intriguing wine offers earthy, piney aromas and a ripe but silky palate packed with dark cherry and blackberry flavors that have good focus and depth. Petite Sirah and Merlot form the majority of the blend.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sketchbook 2018 Artist's Red (Mendocino County)

Description: This well-priced blend of Gaglioppo, Greco Nero and Magliocco is quite expressive on the nose in tones of ripe cherry and blueberry, with savory elements of mentholated herbs and black pepper spicing it up. The palate is plush and soft in delicious berry fruit, but well balanced by bright acidity and smooth tannins. A gentle cherry-skin note lends grip to the close, making this a delicious Calabrian red blend.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Statti 2018 Red (Lamezia)

Description: Black fruits highlight this blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Tannat. The tannins are velvety smooth, and as the wine rolls across the finish it's streaked with notes of coffee and charred wood. It was aged in 30% new French oak for 19 months.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Stratus 2017 Red (Niagara-On-The-Lake)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Dark-skinned fruit, baking spice and crushed violet aromas emerge from the glass. The savory palate features dried black cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vivaldi 2017  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: Plum and raspberry aromas come with back notes of black olive and maduro tobacco. Strong acidity pushes a palate with grip and flavors of plum, currant and oak. Rubbing tannins make a long finish grabby. Drink through 2024.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Eguren Ugarte 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)

Description: Aromas of brandy-dipped blackberry and dark cherry meet warm spice tones on the nose of this Montepulciano. It's plush and rounded on the palate, showing ripe red-berry flavors held in check by fresh acidity and finely knit tannins. It's a supple expression of the variety, and will please those looking for a soft yet well-balanced red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Feudo Antico 2016 Rosso Red (Tullum)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas recalling mature dark-skinned fruit, tobacco and a balsamic note of camphor emerge from the glass. The chewy, brawny palate offers black currant jam, vanilla and licorice alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2028.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Domìni Veneti 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: Made predominantly with Nero d'Avola, Petit Verdot and Syrah, this red has aromas of French oak, eucalyptus, warm spice and blue flower. The medium-bodied palate is both concentrated yet lifted, offering sour cherry, nutmeg and star anise alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that leave a mouthdrying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2016 Mille e una Notte Red (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, cooking spices and underbrush emerge from the glass. The chewy, savory palate features baked plum, clove and black pepper alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ca' Rugate 2015 Punta 470  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of baked plum, cooking spices and cedar. On the dense palate, velvety tannins envelope prune, espresso and cocoa. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castellani Michele & Figli 2016 Colle Cristi  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: A blend of Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with aromas of violet, new leather, menthol and stewed prune. The aromas carry over to the fleshy palate along with notes of star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Vicchiomaggio 2016 La Prima Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Outright raisiny aromas cross the line from very ripe into overripe, while this feels fully saturated on the palate. Extracted cassis and blackberry flavors are at maximum plus on the ripeness meter, while this tastes rich and chocolaty on a hulking finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Perinet 2016 1194 Red (Priorat)

Description: Red currants and strawberries flood the palate as this rich and broad-textured blend of Carignan, Merlot and Zinfandel fills the mouth with supple ripeness. It's rounded and welcoming and plenty fruity.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2018 Domo Red (Lodi)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Leather, baked plum and truffle aromas emerge from the glass. The savory, brawny palate offers black cherry jam, tobacco and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Armani 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: A blend of 60% Greco Nero and 40% Magliocco, this tangy red offers a tense cranberry flavor alongside savory, resinous herbs. Finely knit tannins lend a delicate frame, with bright acidity and a crushed granite quality lifting it all up. It's energetic and lively, ending on a lingering cherry skin tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Benvenuto 2018 Terra Red (Calabria)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Mature black-skinned berry, coconut and tobacco aromas lead the nose. The brawny palate offers dried black cherry, star anise and espresso alongside tightly wound tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corteforte 2011 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Savory and polished, this red offers aromas of eucalyptus, fennel seed and dark-skinned berry. The smooth, lithe palate doles out succulent Morello cherry, crushed raspberry and star anise set against graceful tannins and fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2018 Floramundi  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria)

Description: Outright raisiny aromas cross the line from very ripe into overripe, while this feels fully saturated on the palate. Extracted cassis and blackberry flavors are at maximum plus on the ripeness meter, while this tastes rich and chocolaty on a hulking finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Perinet 2016 1194 Red (Priorat)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Leather, baked plum and truffle aromas emerge from the glass. The savory, brawny palate offers black cherry jam, tobacco and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Armani 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: A blend of 60% Greco Nero and 40% Magliocco, this tangy red offers a tense cranberry flavor alongside savory, resinous herbs. Finely knit tannins lend a delicate frame, with bright acidity and a crushed granite quality lifting it all up. It's energetic and lively, ending on a lingering cherry skin tone.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Benvenuto 2018 Terra Red (Calabria)

Description: This opens with aromas of forest floor, black-skinned berries and cooking spices. The solid palate features ripe blackberry, mocha and licorice alongside firm tannins. Drink though 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santi 2015 Santico  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: A blend of 90% Corinto Nero and 10% Nero d'Avola, this offers aromas of toasted nut, graphite, rose petal and new leather. On the enveloping palate, polished tannins accompany fleshy black cherry, hazelnut and baking spice. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Castellaro 2016 Nero Ossidiana Red (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals whiffs of stewed prune, leather and tilled earth. The solid palate offers baked plum, candied raisin and a dollop of vanilla alongside polished, rather relaxed tannins before a bitter almond finish. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tommasi 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: A blend of 60% Nero d'Avola and 40% Frappato, this red offers aromas of graphite, Mediterranean scrub and eucalyptus. On the elegantly structured palate, lithe, fine-grained tannins accompany juicy Marasca cherry, star anise and a hint of coffee bean.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2018  Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico

Description: Balsamic scents of camphor mix with leather, underbrush and French oak aromas. On the palate, notes of roasted coffee bean, salt and star anise accent a core of dried cherry. Assertive, drying tannins leave a lean, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vignamaggio 2016 Monna Lisa Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of violet, red-skinned berries and baking spice. The juicy palate offers red cherry, clove and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa La Pagliaia 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this offers aromas of violet, underbrush and tobacco. The chewy palate features baked plum, licorice and black pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2027.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villalta 2017 I Comunali  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pleasing aromas of plum and dried herb lead to a fruitful, plush palate. There's a nice yum factor to the sumptuous fruit flavors.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Walla Walla Vintners 2018 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Juicy plumminess on the nose is edged with cinnamon. The palate adds juicy cherry and a lick of dark chocolate. Fine tannins are supple and give a lovely bite to the finish, smooth as all of this is.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Zantho 2017 Cuvée 1488 Red (Burgenland)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, camphor and crushed herb form the nose of this blend of Corvina, Corvinone, Rondinella and Sangiovese. On the taut, medium-bodied palate, firm, fine-grained tannins accompany raisin, prune and licorice. Drink through 2023.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Allegrini 2017 Palazzo della Torre Red (Veronese)

Description: This opens with aromas of dark-skinned berry, scorched earth and mocha. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Monterinaldi 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Mature plum, truffle and whiff of game form the earthy nose. Reflecting the aromas, the medium-bodied palate features prune, dried cherry and tobacco alongside taut tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello Vicchiomaggio 2016 Agostino Petri  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Plum cake, leather and black-skinned berry aromas come together in the glass. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, licorice and clove alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Moschina 2011 Niero  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, toasted hazelnuts and cooking spices emerge from the glass. The structured palate offers blackberry jam, mocha and tobacco alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Damoli 2015 Checo  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Roasted fennel, smoked cherries and seasoning-salt aromas show on the nose of this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Savory flavors of smoked meat and salumi meet with cranberry, fig paste and licorice spice on the palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hawk Watch Winery 2015 The Deep Six Red (South Coast)

Description: Mint and chocolate notes merge with ripe blackberries in this full-bodied but polished wine that has good balance and mild tannins. Made from multiple vintages, it's a timeless, value-oriented Zinfandel blend that keeps on truckin'.                      Jim Gordon
Designation: OVR Old Vine Red Lot Number 70
Name: Marietta Cellars NV OVR Old Vine Red Lot Number 70 Red (California)

Description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this has aromas of menthol, blue flowers, toast and oak-driven spice. The taut, medium-bodied palate offers dried cherry, prune and roasted coffee bean alongside fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Fonterutoli 2017 Ser Lapo  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Baked plum, mocha and baking spice aromas waft out of the glass. The concentrated palate delivers prune, licorice and espresso alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattori 2015 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this offers aromas of mocha, cedar and violet. The savory palate features spiced plum, espresso and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fidora 2014 Monte Tabor  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Tilled soil, black-skinned berry and underbrush aromas emerge from the glass. The chewy palate features black cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside velvety tannins and fresh acidity. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Lecci e Brocchi 2016 Il Chiorba Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Cedar and baking-spice aromas lead to rich black-fruit flavors and moderate tannins in this showy, oaky, extravagant and full-bodied wine made from mostly Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. It's expressive, mouthfilling and ripe tasting.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McNab Ridge 2017 Family Reserve Red (Mendocino)

Description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this has aromas of menthol, blue flowers, toast and oak-driven spice. The taut, medium-bodied palate offers dried cherry, prune and roasted coffee bean alongside fine-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Fonterutoli 2017 Ser Lapo  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Baked plum, mocha and baking spice aromas waft out of the glass. The concentrated palate delivers prune, licorice and espresso alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattori 2015 Riserva  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: This fresh, zesty red blend offers a pleasing mix of fruit, earth and spice tones. Plush red cherry and plum flavors meld with delicate accents of crushed herbs, tilled earth and violet, with ripe, silken tannins and juicy acidity carrying it along. It's light-bodied in feel but savory and lasting—a perfect accompaniment to the dinner table.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Odoardi 2015 1480 L'inizio Red (Calabria)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A unique blend of Merlot, Malbec, Pinot Noir, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Dolcetto, this rich red offers sweet and savory elements in equal measure. Dense black plum, red cherry sauce and delicate warm spices meld with hints of tar, cracked pepper and herbs. It's all held in check by a suave webbing of tannins and lifted by fresh acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: One Woman 2015 Roccia Red (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit, cedar and mocha. The ripe palate shows black plum jam, espresso and star anise alongside velvety tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Cottini 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: Foraged raspberry and blackberry are brambly and wild on the nose. Juicy cherry, raspberry and cranberry are cheerful on the palate, while bouncy acidity and gentle tannins add support. A dried herb and raw oak tone sneaks in on the finish to anchor the juicy cherry tone.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Pearmund NV Virginia's Heritage Red (Virginia)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting underbrush, leather and camphor mingle together in the glass along with a whiff of cassis. The rather syrupy palate is evolved in terms of fruit richness, offering dried black cherry, prune, grilled bell pepper and coffee bean alongside close-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Rocca delle Macìe 2016 Ser Gioveto Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This fresh, zesty red blend offers a pleasing mix of fruit, earth and spice tones. Plush red cherry and plum flavors meld with delicate accents of crushed herbs, tilled earth and violet, with ripe, silken tannins and juicy acidity carrying it along. It's light-bodied in feel but savory and lasting—a perfect accompaniment to the dinner table.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Odoardi 2015 1480 L'inizio Red (Calabria)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: A unique blend of Merlot, Malbec, Pinot Noir, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Dolcetto, this rich red offers sweet and savory elements in equal measure. Dense black plum, red cherry sauce and delicate warm spices meld with hints of tar, cracked pepper and herbs. It's all held in check by a suave webbing of tannins and lifted by fresh acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: One Woman 2015 Roccia Red (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit, cedar and mocha. The ripe palate shows black plum jam, espresso and star anise alongside velvety tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Paolo Cottini 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: Foraged raspberry and blackberry are brambly and wild on the nose. Juicy cherry, raspberry and cranberry are cheerful on the palate, while bouncy acidity and gentle tannins add support. A dried herb and raw oak tone sneaks in on the finish to anchor the juicy cherry tone.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Pearmund NV Virginia's Heritage Red (Virginia)

Description: Made with 95% Sangiovese and 5% of Canaoilo and Colorino, this has aromas of blue flowers, ripe wild berries and camphor with a whiff of vanilla. On the taut, vibrant palate, firm, fine-grained tannins support juicy red cherry, clove and star anise. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Podere Il Palazzino 2016 Argenina  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Black cherry and black pepper aromas follow through to the racy palate along with ground cloves and wild herbs. Dusty rather drying tannins provide support.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria San Michele a Torri 2018 Tenuta La Gabbiola  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Smooth and succulent, this has aromas of ripe black fruit, menthol and baking spice. The accessible palate offers prune, fleshy blackberry and carob alongside soft tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Arancio 2015 Riserva Red (Sicilia)

Appellation: Val di Neto, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from Magliocco, this smooth red offers supple flavors of red cherry and plum bolstered by allspice, cinnamon and clove. The tannins show a lovely polish and the acidity is well integrated, making this a well-balanced Calabrian red.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Librandi 2016 Magno Megonio Red (Val di Neto)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dark-red-fruit aromas of pomegranate show flashes of freshness and meet with wet earth and dark rose petals on the nose of this blend of 44% Syrah, 34% Sangiovese and 22% Cabernet Sauvignon. Focused flavors of blackberry, wet rocks, leather and sandalwood show on the sip.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rancho Sisquoc 2018 Tre Vini Red (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Almost irresistible chocolate and cinnamon aromas blend nicely with rich, black-cherry and black fig flavors in this full-bodied, generously oaked wine. A moderately tannic texture keeps it good and grippy on the palate.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Blacklist 2018 Red (Lodi)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of French oak, coconut, fruitcake and eucalyptus take shape on this full-bodied red. The tightly wound, assertive palate offers raisin, incense and orange zest framed in close-grained, rather astringent tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bolla 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: Saucy aromas of tomato, red plum, currant and green herbs are low on ripeness, especially for a blend of Carmenère and Cabernet Sauvignon from Apalta in the Colchagua Valley. A tight and narrow palate is more hollow than full, likely a reflection of harvest rains in 2016. Saucy, herbal plum flavors are mildly green, while this finishes long but light, with buttery oak notes.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Neyen 2016 Espíritu de Apalta Carmenère-Cabernet Sauvignon (Apalta)

Description: A blend of 50% Nero d'Avola, 25% Merlot, 20% Syrah and 5% Cabernet Franc, this juicy red has vinous aromas of just pressed grapes, black-skinned fruit and a hint of Mediterranean scrub. It's savory and easygoing, doling out juicy blackberry, fleshy black cherry and a hint of carob alongside supple tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Planeta 2018 La Segreta Red (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, tobacco and tilled soil lead the nose. The savory palate offers blackberry, clove and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bocce 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Mouthfilling and rich in fruit and oak spices, this full-bodied wine is smooth and light in tannins. It leads with 34% of the Portuguese grape variety Touriga Nacional, and roughly thirds of Merlot and Petite Sirah.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Markus Wine Co 2018 Toura Red (Lodi)

Description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are dried and suggest prune and licorice. A solid palate with rubbing tannins offers lightly blackened flavors of berry fruits, raisin and plum, with toasty oak taking over the aftertaste and finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués del Atrio 2017 Crianza Edición Limitada  (Rioja)

Description: Baked plum, cocoa and mocha aromas emerge from the glass. The densely concentrated, one-dimensional palate offers prune, date and star anise alongside velvety tannins and the warmth of evident alcohol.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Zovo 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, Mediterranean brush and cooking spices emerge from the glass. The juicy palate offers black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Calcinaia 2017 Piegaia  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Underbrush, French oak, leather and dried botanical herb aromas appear in the glass along with a whiff of violet. The straightforward palate shows dried cherry, coffee bean and star anise alongside solid tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Banfi 2015 Fonte alla Selva Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Violet, wild berry and botanical herb aromas shape the alluring nose on this straightforward, enjoyable red. On the smooth palate, polished tannins accompany ripe Morello cherry, star anise and a sprinkle of white pepper. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Banfi 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blue flower, French oak and camphor aromas mingle together in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the austere palate features coconut, espresso and vanilla along with notes of prune and dried cherry. It's rather lean on fruit richness; close-grained tannins grip the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2016 Castello di Brolio Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: A blend of 80% Sangiovese, 15% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas of French oak, scorched earth, blue flowers and camphor. It's austere and lean in terms of fruit richness, offering roasted coffee bean, toasted nuts and suggestions of orange rind and prune. Assertive, rather astringent tannins leave a firm, mouthdrying close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2017 Brolio Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of black plum, tobacco and cooking spices lead the way. The chewy palate offers prune, clove and star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Negrar 2017  Amarone della Valpolicella

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of ripe black plum, scorched earth and espresso. The rather evolved palate offers prune, cocoa and vanilla alongside smooth tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castellani Michele & Figli 2016 I Castei Campo Casalin  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Aromas recalling red berries, rose petals and violets are front and center on this fragrant red. On the bright, sleek palate, lithe tannins and bright acidity accompany juicy sour cherries and hints of ground clove. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castellare di Castellina 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of toasted walnut, oak and scorched earth lead the nose. The chewy, straightforward palate offers prune, tobacco and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Cacchiano 2015  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of black-skinned berries, tobacco and tilled soil lead the nose. The savory palate offers blackberry, clove and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bocce 2016  Chianti Classico

Description: Aromas of tilled soil, mocha and tobacco emerge from the glass. The ripe palate offers prune, star anise and espresso alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Podere Ciona 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, underbrush and leather. The savory, accessible palate offers black cherry, clove and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Quercia al Poggio 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Earthy berry aromas are lightly herbal, with a note of animal hide that adds complexity. A punchy palate is tightly wound and fresh in feel, with blackberry and light oak flavors. A touch of caramelized sweetness makes an otherwise tannic and grabby finish a bit more friendly.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués del Atrio 2019  Rioja

Description: Aromas of tilled soil, mocha and tobacco emerge from the glass. The ripe palate offers prune, star anise and espresso alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Podere Ciona 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, underbrush and leather. The savory, accessible palate offers black cherry, clove and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Quercia al Poggio 2018  Chianti Classico

Description: Blueberry and candied violet waft from the glass. The palate mirrors the nose, offering juicy acidity and a soft mouthfeel. It's simple, but tasty culminating on a long, fruity finish.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Horton NV Dio Red (Virginia)

Description: Aromas of ripe dark-skinned fruit, mocha and cooking spices emerge from the glass. The forward, one-dimensional palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and tobacco alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Saltari 2012  Amarone della Valpolicella

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This has aromas suggesting black-skinned berries, leather and underbrush. The solid palate offers blackberry extract, star anise and tobacco alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Negrar 2017 Bartolomeo Lorenzi  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Tilled soil, leather and mocha aromas form the nose. The solid palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and espresso alongside polished tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bertarole 2016 La Marogna  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Earthy berry aromas are lightly herbal, with a note of animal hide that adds complexity. A punchy palate is tightly wound and fresh in feel, with blackberry and light oak flavors. A touch of caramelized sweetness makes an otherwise tannic and grabby finish a bit more friendly.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Marqués del Atrio 2019  Rioja

Description: Aromas of violet, scorched earth and mocha waft out of the glass. The solid, monolithic palate offers ripe black plum, espresso and a dollop of vanilla alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Montresor 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: A blend of organically grown Nero d'Avola and Frappato, this medium-bodied red has inviting aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, menthol and dark spices. The smooth, juicy palate offers ripe black cherry and ground pepper alongside lithe tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santa Tresa 2018  Cerasuolo di Vittoria

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Black-skinned berry, tilled soil and mocha aromas shape the nose. The chewy, solid palate shows blackberry jam, roasted coffee bean and star anise alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bertarole 2016 N'C Rian  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed Nero d'Avola and Frappato, this offers aromas of ripe dark-skinned berry, eucalyptus and whiffs of French oak. On the bright, linear palate, notes of coffee bean and toasted nut accent a core of Morello cherry. Taut tannins provide the framework. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cortese 2018 Sabuci  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico)

Description: Aromas of tilled soil, tobacco and mocha lead the nose. The warm, dense palate recalls baked plum, espresso and coconut alongside velvety tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Costa Arènte 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella

Appellation: Cerasuolo di Vittoria, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: A blend of organically grown Nero d'Avola and Frappato, this medium-bodied red has inviting aromas of ripe black-skinned berry, menthol and dark spices. The smooth, juicy palate offers ripe black cherry and ground pepper alongside lithe tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Santa Tresa 2018  Cerasuolo di Vittoria

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Nail polish, stewed prune and leather aromas are front and center on this fleshy red. The aromas carry on to the densely concentrated, evolved palate along with chocolate-covered raisin and blackberry jam alongside loose-knit, chalky tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zenato 2008 Archivio Storico  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Wild, funky, gamy aromas of leathery plum and currant comprise a gritty and rough nose. This is a scrappy blended Jumilla red with grapy weight and a pop of freshening acidity. Savory plum, herbal berry and smoked meat flavors finish spicy and intense.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ego Bodegas 2018 Don Baffo Red (Jumilla)

Description: Aromas of violet and wild berries are front and center on this medium-bodied red. It's straightforward, offering ripe cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside taut, rather drying tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria di Petroio 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Made with Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of French oak, blue flowers, coconut and underbrush. The smooth, concentrated palate offers baked plum, licorice and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Sodi 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Dense aromas of raspberry and blackberry jam are lifted by hints of herbal spice and iodine in this blend of Sangiovese, Magliocco and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's smooth on entry, driven by flavors of mixed berries and supported by a vein of bright acidity. Woolly tannins coat the mouth with a gentle, fuzzy feel, playing well with the tangy fruit.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Poderi Marini 2017 Korone Red (Calabria)

Description: Earthy, woodsy aromas and rich, mulled fruit flavors ride a smooth, lightly tannic texture in this full-bodied, brooding wine made mostly from Zinfandel, with Petite Sirah, Carignan and Mataro blended in. It's not overtly fruity or oaky but offers a savory, meaty expression that's intriguing.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Ridge 2018 Three Valleys Red (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of baked plum, cake spice and mocha shape the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, espresso and licorice alongside assertive tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Antiche Terre Venete 2017 Baorna  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Description: Bright and easygoing, this has aromas of ripe red-skinned fruit and tilled earth with a whiff of blue flowers. The straightforward palate offers mature Marasca cherry and clove alongside solid tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Banfi 2018 Fonte alla Selva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals suggestions of scorched earth, underbrush, tobacco leaf and leather. Showing the heat of the vintage, the palate is already rather evolved, offering prune, toasted nut and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside close-grained that leave a grippy, astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Querceto 2017 Il Picchio Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Wild, funky, gamy aromas of leathery plum and currant comprise a gritty and rough nose. This is a scrappy blended Jumilla red with grapy weight and a pop of freshening acidity. Savory plum, herbal berry and smoked meat flavors finish spicy and intense.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Ego Bodegas 2018 Don Baffo Red (Jumilla)

Description: Aromas of violet and wild berries are front and center on this medium-bodied red. It's straightforward, offering ripe cherry and a hint of baking spice alongside taut, rather drying tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Fattoria di Petroio 2017  Chianti Classico

Description: Made with Sangiovese and 5% Canaiolo, this opens with aromas of French oak, blue flowers, coconut and underbrush. The smooth, concentrated palate offers baked plum, licorice and espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: I Sodi 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Made with 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot, this has aromas of mocha, cedar and black-skinned berry. The dense palate shows black currant jam, espresso and coconut alongside grainy tannins. Drink 2022–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Setriolo 2015 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Blending Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Syrah, Merlot and Malbec into a gigantic whole, this wine is richly viscous and woven in a sweetness of black cherry, vanilla and pronounced oak. Intensely ripe, it has touches of sage and cedar.                      Virginie Boone
Name: The Prisoner 2017 Derange Red (Napa Valley)

Description: This rich blend of 80% Primitivo and 20% Negroamaro is driven by ripe aromas of raspberry and blackberry jam, with firm doses of Chinese five spice, tilled earth and peppercorn. Fleshy, jammy fruit flavors are lifted by ripping acidity on the full-bodied palate, with well-mannered tannins framing it all. It ends spicy, showing noticeable alcoholic heat.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Tombacco 2017 Azzurra Red (Puglia)

Description: Gamy, meaty red-fruit aromas include a hint of iodine in front of a medium-bodied palate with rubbing tannins. Savory plum and animal notes include a pop of candied plum, while this blend of Barbera, Garnacha and Carignan settles on savory flavors as it finishes with clamping tannins.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Erasmo 2016 Estate Bottled Barbera-Garnacha-Carignan Red (Maule Valley)

Description: This has aromas of toasted oak, cooking spices and scorched earth. The dense, hearty palate offers roasted coffee bean, baked plum and a hint of clove alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Falezze 2013  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, mocha and baking spice. The ripe, solid palate offers prune, tobacco and espresso alongside smooth tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Giuva 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: Packed in an extremely heavy, and therefore non-eco-friendly bottle, this opens with aromas of mocha, underbrush and cedar. The straightforward palate offers cherry marinated in spirits, clove and green peppercorn alongside assertive tannins. Drink 2022–2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Le Bocce 2013 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: A blend of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Merlot, this opens with aromas recalling cassis, baking spice and underbrush. The straightforward palate shows mature black cherry, clove and a hint of green peppercorn alongside pliant tannins. Drink through 2024.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Melini 2017 Granaio  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, baked plum and caramel lead the nose. The palate offers espresso, dried black cherry and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nittardi 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Terre di Cosenza, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Nearly opaque in the glass, this rich blend of Aglianico and Magliocco offers dense aromas of iodine, crushed mussel shells and blackberry. It's rich and full on the palate, filled out by thick-skinned black fruit tones that skirt the line between jammy and fresh. While the tannins are copious, there's a decent polish to them, lending ample support alongside fresh acidity. It ends slightly hot, but not overwhelmingly so.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Poderi Marini 2016 Elaphe Red (Terre di Cosenza)

Description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, baked plum and caramel lead the nose. The palate offers espresso, dried black cherry and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nittardi 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Terre di Cosenza, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Nearly opaque in the glass, this rich blend of Aglianico and Magliocco offers dense aromas of iodine, crushed mussel shells and blackberry. It's rich and full on the palate, filled out by thick-skinned black fruit tones that skirt the line between jammy and fresh. While the tannins are copious, there's a decent polish to them, lending ample support alongside fresh acidity. It ends slightly hot, but not overwhelmingly so.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Poderi Marini 2016 Elaphe Red (Terre di Cosenza)

Description: Fairly extracted aromas of red berries and leather show on the nose of this red blend. The palate is full of concentrated black-plum juice and light clove spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Alma de Cattleya 2018 Red (Sonoma County)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, roasted coffee bean and vanilla lead the nose. The firm palate offers clove, dried orange slice and black currant jam alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cà della Scala 2015  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: Aromas of baked plum, mocha and cooking spices come together on this. On the solid, forward palate, chewy tannins accompany prune, espresso and star anise.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Monteforte 2016 Prima Pietra  (Amarone della Valpolicella)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of baked plum, charred earth and baking spice emerge from the glass. The hearty palate shows prune, star anise and vanilla alongside smooth tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Negrar 2017 Le Preare  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting prune, underbrush and botanical herbs along with a whiff of rusty nail. The medium-bodied, no-frills palate offers dried cherry, star anise and a hint of espresso alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink soon.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castelli del Grevepesa 2015 Lamole Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, mocha and baking spice. The ripe, solid palate offers prune, tobacco and espresso alongside smooth tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Giuva 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Mocha, scorched earth and raisin aromas emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers prune, star anise and espresso alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palazzo Maffei 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: This opens with aromas of espresso, coconut and toasted oak. The dense palate offers roasted coffee bean, prune and clove alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Luiano 2016 Ottantuno Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This dense red has aromas suggesting scorched earth, baked plum and toasted hazelnut. The one-dimensional palate offers raisin, mocha and a note of powdered sage alongside pliant tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vivaldi 2017 Premium  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of scorched earth, toasted nut and a whiff of grilled herb. The dense, medium-bodied palate presents prune, blackberry extract, powdered sage and a hint of star anise alongside astringent tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2016 Lu Patri Red (Sicilia)

Description: Dark-skinned fruit, cocoa and toasted hazelnut aromas lead the nose on this solid red. The chewy palate offers roasted coffee bean, licorice and spiced plum alongside tightly packed tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Covalli 2017  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: Aromas of cassis, French oak, toasted nut and eucalyptus form the nose. The palate reflects the heat of the vintage, offering dried cherry, prune, powdered sage and coconut alongside close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2017 Tancredi Red (Sicilia)

Description: Plum, cherry and oak-driven aromas set up a medium-bodied palate with snappy acidity. Red plum, currant and face-value oak flavors are a standard package for Navarra, while juicy acidity keeps this on course through the finish.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Faustino Rivero Ulecia 2016 Crianza Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon (Navarra)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Mocha, scorched earth and raisin aromas emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers prune, star anise and espresso alongside close-grained tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Palazzo Maffei 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella Classico

Description: This opens with aromas of scorched earth, toasted nut and a whiff of grilled herb. The dense, medium-bodied palate presents prune, blackberry extract, powdered sage and a hint of star anise alongside astringent tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2016 Lu Patri Red (Sicilia)

Description: Inviting aromas of red berries and violet lead the nose along with a whiff of camphor. The smooth, light-bodied palate offers fleshy Morello cherry, white pepper and coffee notes alongside soft tannins. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Barone Ricasoli 2017 Guicciarda  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a good, full-bodied red wine that offers attractive ripe berry flavors, a rich texture and a bit of tannin for structure. Its blackberry, beef and pomegranate notes keep developing in the glass.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bella Grace 2017 1646 Red (Amador County)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of ripe black plum, scorched earth and espresso. The rather evolved palate offers prune, cocoa and vanilla alongside smooth tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castellani Michele & Figli 2016 Rengo  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas of espresso, coconut and toasted oak. The dense palate offers roasted coffee bean, prune and clove alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Luiano 2016 Ottantuno Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Aromas of blue flowers and wild berries with a whiff of leather form the delicate nose. On the easygoing palate, light tannins gently support red cherry, orange zest and a hint of star anise. Drink through 2022.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Collazzi 2017 Bastioni  (Chianti Classico)

Description: Roasted coffee bean, toasted oak and sage aromas emerge from the glass. The robust palate offers prune, coconut and mocha alongside chewy tannins.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Corte Adami 2016  Amarone della Valpolicella

Description: Made primarily with Nero d'Avola along with Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and other varieties, this has aromas of toasted nut, grilled herb, eucalyptus and blue flower. On the bright, savory palate, pulverized tannins accompany dried black cherry, prune and hints of baking spices.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Donnafugata 2018 Sèdara Red (Sicilia)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This Bordeaux-style red blend is upfront in tones of coffee, tar and freshly cut green herbs. Red fruit rides in the background, taking on a slightly jammy quality. The palate is lithe in feel, driven by pulsing acidity and framed by delicate tannins. Shades of green peppercorn and dark cocoa arise on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Pellegrini Vineyards 2015 Regalo Estate Grown Unfiltered Red (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Aromas of blue flowers, menthol, leather and French oak form the nose. The assertive, austere palate features coconut, star anise and espresso alongside prune and orange zest. Close-grained, extremely astringent tannins leave a drying finish. Despite the firm tannins, drink sooner rather than later to catch the remaining fruit.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Poggio al Sole 2017 Casasilia Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)

Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A 50-50 combo of Zinfandel and Syrah, this rich, thick red is brimming in supple texture and soft layers of dense dark cherry, blackberry and plum. Fruity and appealing across a broad spectrum of palates, it delivers power and concentration.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Dueling Pistols 2017 Red (Dry Creek Valley)

Description: An irresistible blackberry-jam aroma leads to warm baking spices and lots of black plum and milk chocolate in this full-bodied, perhaps slightly sweet, and luxuriously textured wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2017 Phantom Red (California)

Appellation: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This has aromas recalling dark-skinned fruit, cake spice and leather. The ripe, dense palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and hints of white pepper alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2026.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina di Negrar 2015 La Sorte  (Amarone della Valpolicella Classico)

Description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, coconut and a hint of violet lead the way. The firm palate recalls espresso, clove and prune alongside close-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Bibbione 2015 Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
